Ooh! What are you gonna make? A snow cathedral maybe?

options.text: All that's missing is the stripes, then it's perfect.

reply.text: I'd need soot or something for that! I don't wanna get my mittens dirty.

options.text: It even has the hat!

reply.text: The tail was the trickiest part! Snowsculpting is a real art.

206.text: Pests lurk behind the bookshelf. They must be terminated.

comments.text: What kind of pests are we talking here?
The resilient kind whose name inspires fear and disgust... Cockroaches.
Mother of god... Yeah, it's time to terminate all right.
DU-DUN DUN-DUN-DUN! DU-DUN DUN-DUN-DUN!
Good thing we discovered them sooner rather than later! And that we had roach spray in the storage!
Mm, that's all of them. The enroachment has been dealt with.
Pests, you say? I'm something of an expert on disposing of those, should you need help in the future.
Um, I don't think we're on the same page here...

options.text: You didn't... destroy the bookshelf, right?

reply.text: No. Thanks to Gromky's bug spray, we didn't have to resort to that.

options.text: Hasta la vista, roaches.

reply.text: Just hope they won't return with a vengeance.

207.text: The revolution must go on! If ice blocks our path, we shall march THROUGH it!

comments.text: Well said, comrade! Mother nature's coldest obstacles are nothing to our fiery hot resolve!
Yes! We are an unstoppable wave of steel!
Those are inspiring words to me as a leader... But I must ask: do you NP girls really sail through ice all the time?
Don't be ridiculous, we're not icebreakers. We only do it sometimes.
A small embellishment for the sake of illustrating our fighting spirit, comrade. But it's not far from the truth.
interesting. what marvel of Northern Parliament engineering is this?
Engineering has nothing to do with it. We smash through the ice with our sheer determination!

options.text: Just don't ram into the enemy, all right?

reply.text: If the enemy stands in our way, then they will meet the same fate as the ice!

options.text: That's the fighting spirit I like to see!

reply.text: None can match our unwavering resolve!

208.text: POV: you are Captain da Recco's second mate, helping her plot a new course

comments.text: SPIIIIIIIN! Captain, second mate-slash-sailor Libeccio wants to spin it too!
It's all yours! Now get a pen and paper and start jotting down those lats and longs!
How on earth can you see anything when it's spinning so fast?
Two words: high-def eyesight! You kinda develop it over time as a navigator.
What do you say to becoming my own navigator, matey? There's lots of booty in it for you.
This here girl loves to sail the sea, but I'm no pirate! I'm gonna have to kindly decline!

options.text: Don't tell me this is how you actually navigate...

reply.text: What if it is, and I'm just that good? :^)

options.text: Set sail for uncharted waters!

reply.text: Aye-aye, Admiral!

209.text: All my photographs came out blurry, despite my best efforts... Could it be that my camera is broken?

comments.text: No camera can accurately capture your beauty, signorina.
A servicable pickup line, but a poor explanation, I'm afraid.
Whichever your interpretation, I meant it only as a joke.
What were you trying to photograph, Veneto?
The beach, of course! Every moment at the beach deserves to be immortalized.
I might be able to help. When did you buy it? What model is it?
In order: the other day, and I don't know. A green-haired cat in a hat and sunglasses sold it to me at a discount.
Tried using a tripod? Usually that helps. I can DM you some good ones if you want
It does? By all means, I'd love your recommendations!

options.text: Try adjusting the focus. On the camera, and on the subject.

reply.text: Oh! That made a significant difference! Thank you, Commander!

210.text: A Sardegnian dignitary must always act with splendor, no matter the task at hand.

comments.text: Uncorking a bottle with a rapier isn't "splendor," that's just showing off! Ngl though I wanna learn how to do it!
When you've grown, I will teach you. A rapier is too much for a "fun-sized" girl to handle.
Aww come on! How can I be old enough to serve in the navy but a rapier's outta my league?!
Sardegnian crimson nectar doth live up to its reputation, I must say.
I am glad to hear it. Know that you're always welcome to our private banquets.
Such remarkable swordsmanship! We must spar together sometime, I implore you!
Many a legend have I heard of Iris' swordfighters. I shall add a duel to my bucket list.

options.text: Where's the line between splendor and showiness?

reply.text: Sincerity. Vanity has a distinct smell, one which I steer very clear of.

211.text: Ah, what a lovely tea party this was! Thank you for joining me, my Iron Blood friend!

comments.text: This frivolous little gathering proved more entertaining than I thought.
You really loved my tea and sweets, didn't you? I'm glad! I went all-out with them.
They played no small part in my enjoyment. That much, I will admit.
For but this brief moment, Graf Zeppelin's visage was free of detest and displeasure.
Gaiety is not in my nature, nor does it suit me. Don't aggrandize this photograph.
You sound like such good friends~ Z46, I'd love to have you at our next tea party!
A gracious offer. I thank you.

options.text: I suppose Graf doesn't hate tea parties, at least.

reply.text: You'd be surprised by how fun it is talking to her when she's in a good mood~

comments.text: Growing out of a tin can?
mhm... aren't they pretty? I need more containers so I can grow a whole colony of them... hehehe...
Are they edible? I could make a yummy sautÃ© out of them if so!
they're not poisonous at least... I could spare a few, I guess...
Not poisonous does not necessarily mean edible...
that corner looks cool and cozy. mind if I come join you?
make yourself at home... the more, the merrier... hehehe...

options.text: Mushrooms can grow indoors? In a can, at that?

reply.text: shrooms are hardy little friends... they can survive and thrive almost anywhere... even your private quarters if given the chance... hehehe...

213.text: Always study for your tests, everyone. Make your teachers proud.

comments.text: That's exactly what I want to hear! Gold star for you, Maestrale!
A gold star? I thought that was just common sense? Well, thank you in any case!
I WISH it was! My job would be so much easier if all my pupils were half as diligent as you.
But studying is haaard! My brain is too smooth to comprehend trigonomewhatchamacallit!
It really isn't... Should I help you with it? You picked up algebra quickly after I explained it to you.
Yes please! I'll take anything that helps me get a passing grade at least!

options.text: We have an up-and-coming ace student.

reply.text: I wouldn't say I'm an ace student, I just happen to be good at this subject... But thank you.

options.text: I hope Libeccio won't flunk.

reply.text: You and me both! If Maestrale can't help me understand this alien math, I'm toast!

214.text: Hohoho! Nothing beats a cup of tea in the evening, isn't that right, my fellow ladies?

comments.text: the teabag is still in the cup... isn't that frowned upon by hoity-toity types...?
Not when it's black tea, which this fortunately is! Oh yes, everyone knows that!
Mmmm I'd love a cup of black tea right about now
Who wouldn't? It tastes so delectable, so full, so... um, you know, wonderful!
Take care not to drink too much before bedtime. Black tea is high in caffeine.
That would explain the buzz... I might be reaching caffeine saturation already.

options.text: It's not everyone's cup of tea, but it's good.

reply.text: Speaking of which, do you want some tea too, Commander? There's lots to go around!

215.text: Whoopsie. I may have gone over budget.

comments.text: It's so easy to lose track of how much you've spent when you're out shopping.
Hang on Shangri La, I thought you of all people would have good self-control?
Impulse spending gets even the best of us, I'm afraid.
Psst~ You can spend all your money from the comfort of your own room by shopping online~
But it's not the same, it's all virtual and intangible... You don't even get what you ordered until days later!
I suppose it's a form of delayed gratification... And still, you can spend more than you intend to, even online.

options.text: Spend it while you've got it, I say.

reply.text: Money's whole purpose is to be spent, so I guess you've got a point.

options.text: Looks like you need help carrying it all back.

reply.text: Is that a pickup line, or a pickup offer? Either way, I'll take you up on it!

216.text: Man, this movie was so good I didn't wanna blink and miss a single moment!

comments.text: I know right? The cinematography, the framing, everything was top-notch! Best film in decades!
Don'tcha just love it when a movie lives up to the reviewer hype?
Meh I'm sleeping on going to the movies until they make a sequel to We Live in a Society.
Sure that one's good, but sleeping on Roidzilla vs. The Gorillator? That's doing yourself a disservice, girl!
Ice cream... during a movie...?
What about it? It's not a typical movie snack, but it doesn't give you a dry mouth like popcorn does.

options.text: I've got it! Next week is movie week at the port!

reply.text: Movie week lezgoooo!

options.text: Just watch it so your ice cream doesn't spill.

reply.text: Easy. How could I call myself an Iowa if I'd let my clothes get dirty?

217.text: Hey kiddies! I'm Archerfish, your teacher for today! Let's dive into the world of marine biology!

comments.text: I love field trips to the aquarium! Even if I don't understand anything, I always leave feeling smarter!
Mhm, that's what's called intellectual stimulation~
So I've been thinking... We're submarines. Can't we just go in the tanks to have a closer look at the fish?
huh... never thought about that before.
you think they'd let us?
No, fishbrains! No scales, no entry!
is that... a giant isopod plush?
Ding-ding, right on the mark! I got it from the souvenir shop. Pretty neat, huh?

options.text: Tell me some more about marine life.

reply.text: You want some hands-on solo tutoring? Sure can do, hottie! Hehehe~

comments.text: I love this ride! Let's go on it again!
Heck yeah! And after, we'll go on even splashier ride!
siiiick. should've told me you were going to the water park!
I didn't think you'd be into it, U-37! We'll definitely invite you next time!
It felt like my heart was going to pop out of my chest... I don't really wanna ride it again...
It's less scary if you sit in the front and have someone hugging you from behind!

options.text: Looks like all the fun of a roller coaster and a water slide both at once.

reply.text: Yup yup, it is! You should come with us and try it sometime, Commander!

options.text: Just hope I-25 didn't lose her lunch...

reply.text: Fortunately not, but I was very close to giving up the ghost...

219.text: Strap in cause it's gonna be a WIIIIILD RIIIIIIIDE!!!

comments.text: Wowie, I'm seeing stars! And I'm not just talking about myself!
Them's the guiding stars named Thrill, Ecstasy, and Vertigo!
This looks even more exciting than the water coaster!
A bit TOO exciting, probably...
Ain't no such thing as"too exciting"! Try it, you won't regret it!
Wild roller coasters are so on-brand for SF.
Not so much for me... They make me queasy and dizzy.
Queasy and dizzy is the prime theme park experience, girl! Who cares if you vom a little!

options.text: That loop-the-loop looks too intense for most people.

reply.text: You kidding? That's like, the best part! The whole reason you'd ride a roller coaster!

options.text: Imagine NOT strapping in...

reply.text: If anyone's daredevil enough to do it, I salute them!

220.text: We got together and... sang karaoke...

comments.text: Best night out ever! We should totally do it again soon!
I was nervous at first without my mask... but I had fun after getting in the mood...
Can't really sing with a mask on, y'know?
Maybe you can... if you're a shapeshifter at Poe's masquerade...
Why do you cover your face? You shouldn't be afraid to show your beautiful looks, Boise.
It's just that going unmasked is... extremely stressful...
you said this was your first time singing karaoke? you're stupidly talented if so.
I mean, you're a gifted singer too, Lulu...
That's because she's practiced! All she's done for the past week is sing~
I haven't been practicing THAT much! just a little...

options.text: You stole the show with your brilliant singing, Boise.

reply.text: Thanks... You're really good at singing too, Commander...

options.text: The snacks were pretty good for a karaoke bar.

reply.text: Right, yeah! Like the fries, they were great...

221.text: Look, Mr. Bear! A giant robot exhibit!

comments.text: Whoa! Are those tokusatsu mecha props?
I dunno. All I know is they look awesome! I wish they'd let you touch them.
Tell you what, I could make a cosplay if I had more reference pics! Wanna take some together?
Oh! I'd love to.
mecha, hmm? interesting. we're officially abandoning ship development to work on giant robots.
Wait, are you serious?!
no, it's called making a silly joke.
I've got spare figs of these guys~ I'm low on display space so whoever wants one, hmu~
For free?! I do!

options.text: Ah! This hand of mine burns with an awesome power!

reply.text: Take this! My love, my anger, and all of my sorrow!

options.text: Trying to touch the valuable props? I'll stop you!

reply.text: It doesn't matter how strong you are if you can't hit me! Muahaha!

222.text: The Manjuuland Mirror Maze is a lovely little attraction.

comments.text: It's so weird seeing mirror clones of yourself at all these different angles...
Yes, it is weird. So weird that some of us get lost in the maze. Isn't that right, sister?
Oh be quiet! I didn't get lost, you just walked off without me!
It's always a fun time. Sometimes I get distracted and walk into the mirrors though...
try to watch where YOU'RE going, not your mirror images...
Oh yes. The amusement park is just wonderful, especially if you're going with friends.
It sure is. Speaking of which, would you like to come with us next time?
I'll have to check my schedule, but I'd love to if I can~

options.text: Did you make it out of the maze in the end?

reply.text: Duh. Otherwise we'd be sending SOS's, not be casually posting on Juustagram.

options.text: Let's go there together next time then.

reply.text: Chao Ho showed me the way out. After flipping her lid and storming ahead, that is. Heheh~

223.text: The sun is shining, the birds are singing, and I am having a wonderful day.

comments.text: Don't forget to use sun cream if you plan to lounge in the sun all day.
Appearances, Formidable! Being on vacation is no excuse to slack on your etiquette!
Yes, yes, I know. I'll mind my manners.
Comfy air-conditioned room with vidya > Going outside and melting like butter in the sun
this tbh ^
That's why they have a pool for you to cool off in. Come on outside and touch grass, ladies.
Nothing beats ice cream on a hot day! What flavour is it? Sweet sea salt?
Correct! It tastes a lot like the sea, actually.

options.text: How's the water?

reply.text: Well... I've not tried it just yet. Let me sunbathe for another 5 minutes first.

options.text: Just watch it so your ice cream doesn't spill.

reply.text: First New Jersey, now me? Are you perhaps trying to make this into your catchphrase, hmm?

224.text: Yikes... I'm never doing campfire ghost stories again...

comments.text: It's okay, Isuzu. They're just stories, they can't hurt you.
Stories draw inspiration from reality. Not all are real, but some are. Maybe the one about the hallway shade is...
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA STOOOOOOOP!!!
It's all right, Isuzu! If you ever need someone to go with you when it's dark, I'll do it~
listening to more ghost stories is a good way to get desensitized, actually. makes them less scary.
I'd rather not listen to ANY ghost stories or I'll never sleep at night again!
Apparitions are but spawns of the mind. To fear them is to be pointlessly self-confined.
Things can be scary AND entirely real, you know! Like you when you're sleepwalking!

options.text: Maybe some roasted marshmallows would help Isuzu.

reply.text: Oh right, marshmallows! I knew we were missing something!

225.text: To sleep, perchance to dream. Aye, there's the rub. I was sleepwalking, and in my slumber, I heard a scream.

comments.text: You were just sleepwalking?! Good lord, you scared the life out of me when I saw you...
For causing you a fright, I apologize. This phenomenon is rare, only occurring when I truly close my eyes.
You should get that looked at before you become the inspiration for some creepypasta...
I think I've solved the mystery of things that go bump in the night... It's just Champagne walking into furniture.
I wouldn't be so quick to dismiss "night bumps" as mere fiction. I know many spirits who'd haunt you for it.
And besides, you can't sell horror fiction if there's a rational explanation for every spooky thing, nya!
A condition turned a novelty, rendered into a story and sold as a commodity...

options.text: I'll admit, she does look pretty frightening in this picture...

reply.text: Fear, they say, gives us chills and makes us shiver. Is fear, then, not the best repellent of the heat of summer?

226.text: Commander want me. Fish fear me.

comments.text: didn't know you were into fishing, weser. neat, I am too
Sort of, but not really? I just see fishing as something to do while you're relaxing by the seaside.
hey that's good too, we could hang out and fish casually if you want
caught any big fish? a submarine playin hide and seek maybe?
A garlic shark nibbled, but I had to let it go.
Wait what?! Is U-110 okay?!
It was just a joke. The biggest catch I've made is a carp.
Fish for dinner, then?
If you want them, be my guest. Personally, I'm in the mood for schnitzel tonight.

options.text: Ever caught anything... unusual?

reply.text: I've reeled up plenty of boxes of operation supply coins. You don't need any more of those, right?

227.text: Unite, Little Beavers! The Power Ranchers need our help!

comments.text: Charles, no! They're just actors!
Sorry... My righteous instincts took over me!
You can't deny it was pretty awesome seeing her jump up on stage and yell JUSTICE WILL PREVAIL though!
Yeah, I think that was pretty cool >.<
She totally went into justice mode!
You had me fooled for a sec! I thought your intervention was part of the script.
Bet you wanted to join in on the unscripted fun, eh cooper?
I won't lie and say no, but I didn't have a cool one-liner prepared!

options.text: Did justice prevail in the end?

reply.text: Justice ALWAYS prevails! Red Rancher saved the day and all was good!

options.text: Talk about improv...

reply.text: What can I say? My sense of justice took control of me.

228.text: Don't think I'm gonna ride a Ferris wheel again anytime soon...

comments.text: It was THAT bad? I thought you looked shaken when you got down but dang...
I'm fine. I'm not afraid of heights, it's the strong winds rocking the cabin that got to me.
Rockin' cabin? Dunno about you, but that sounds like a fun time to me!
Sounds like a death trap to me, but sure.
Just have a bottle of liquid courage before boarding and nothing will scare you!
Sounds great, if your goal is to plaster the windows with your own vomit.
Gangut, PLEASE don't drink and ride. The park janitors will hate you for it.

options.text: Want me to bring you something nice and warm to drink?

reply.text: That actually did the trick. Thanks, dear comrade.

229.text: Check us out! We're too swole to control!

comments.text: Oh. You actually posted it. Ugh, I look so silly in this pic...
It's good to take off your serious business mask and do something silly now and then! :D
Me next, Cleve! I want a new Juustagram header!
Sure thing, come over! Anyone else wanna, while we're at it?
Me. Well, just to be the one holding the camera. Be right there...
I know I'm the pot calling the kettle black here, but you look really stiff, Indie. Try to smile for the camera.
I'm aware. My face kind of locks up in unfamiliar situations.

options.text: Weird flex but okay.

reply.text: Thanks, I hate it lmao.

options.text: I think this pic is pretty cool.

reply.text: Cool? I don't see what's cool about it, but... whatever floats your boat.

230.text: I'll admit, sometimes it's nice to forget about schedules and obligations and just have fun.

comments.text: omg sdfdsjsdka I never knew I needed kitty strasser in my life so much until now!!
Glad to know this picture made somebody's day.
Guess who she got them from~? I've got free cat ears for everyone so come on down and claim your pair, Heinrich :3c
For free??? 9 lives here I come!
Enjoying yourself, my dear friend? I hope you are.
Amidst all the noisy rides and saccharine sweets... somehow, yes, I enjoyed myself.
Mwahaha~ With Zep's downfall, I am one step closer to complete global caturation >:3

options.text: Sweet, sweet R&R!

reply.text: Right you are, Officer. A bit of downtime actually increases productivity in the long run. Fascinating, isn't it?

options.text: Might just make cat ears mandatory casual wear.

reply.text: And ruin their novelty factor? The purpose of silly items such as this is to break away from the norm. Alas, you are in command...

231.text: This trek was an adventure from start to finish. I couldn't have made it without you guys!

comments.text: I'm just glad to have been along for the journey! Always fun cooking with a mess kit in the wild ^^
You especially were a huge help, big sis! If you ever want to go camping again, just let me know.
What I learned is a cuppa instant noodles always be good, outdoors or indoors.
What I learned is any food tastes better when you eat it with Cleve.
Oh yeah, true. Everything's better with friends, I guess!
Boy that fresh woodland air tho. Y'know when books say a smell is "intoxicating"? This is what they mean.
It was something else for sure. Wonder how the air on a snowy mountain would smell...

options.text: I'll procure the rations for our next trip.

reply.text: Go right ahead. I probably should've brought something other than just noodles...

232.text: What is my favourite ice cream flavour? Whichever I share with you.

comments.text: Sounds almost like a romantic film quote. That ice cream parlour was lovely, by the way!
Wonderful, isn't it? Everyone I've introduced it to loved it as well.
Next time I will come on an empty stomach and try all their flavours...
ALL of them? I'd worry about the sheer brain freeze sending me to the drydock.
Shall I invite Vestal, just in case? I am sure she would adore the ice cream as well.

options.text: Sharing is caring, and what could be sweeter than that?

reply.text: Well said, "sweetie"! Hehe~

233.text: Dear, oh dear. Now I know how tea feels...

comments.text: Minus the unpleasant feeling of being drunk... As you do with tea.
Incidentally, our cup broke shortly after we got on. They said my "gravity" caused it to tip...
I've had that happen to me as well. They really ought to build these rides of stronger stuff.
I'm not sure I ever wanna go on that ride again...
That's quite all right. Maybe when you're older, you'll have the courage to have another go.
Will you be proud of me if I ride it again, Illustrious? Maybe if I just muster all my courage...
There's no need to force yourself, Unicorn. Illustrious is already proud of you.

options.text: Are you okay, Unicorn?

reply.text: I was scared for a while, but now I'm fine... Thanks for worrying about me...

options.text: Did you enjoy the ride at least, Illustrious?

reply.text: Yes, for the minute or so before it broke, I suppose. It's a shame it was too intense for Unicorn.

234.text: Oh, my child, won't you join me? Come and let the gentle waves rock you like a baby in a cradle.

comments.text: Quite the infantilizing simile. Regardless, one should cherish every interaction with their dear friends.
Infantilizing? Forgive me. I simply cherish the commander... and my Iron Blood comrades... like you were my own children.
Well, "motherly comfort" is fittingly the words I'd use to describe how sitting next to Friedrich feels...
After knowing solitude for so long, I welcome this chance at solidarity...
I'm delighted to read this, Tirpitz. The commander really has warmed you up to social interaction...
If my presence brings you comfort, then don't be shy. There is always space beside me.

options.text: Next time, I wanna paddle the boat.

reply.text: Then paddle you will, my child. Your wish is my command.

options.text: Comfiest nap I've had in weeks.

reply.text: Likewise, it was a deliciously reinvigorating experience for me.

235.text: My, oh my. Where are we?

comments.text: What are you two up to? Having a look around the port?
I offered to give her a tour, and we both wound up getting lost...
It's strange, but I felt we had something in common when I first met her! Turns out, it was our sense of direction.
I see! So this is what they mean by Stand users being drawn to each other!
No worries, everyone. Inazuma and I went out and picked em up.
You're a lifesaver, Hibiki... Thanks.
Yes! Thank you for the assist. Despite us getting lost, it was an enlightening experience.

options.text: I can give you a proper tour around if you want.

reply.text: Oh, you'd do that for me? You're so kind, Commander.

236.text: Tripped again... Luckily Vestal was there to give me a bandaid.

comments.text: Wait, are you all right, Haruka?
Right as rain after Vestal helped! Thanks for asking, Chihaya!
Phew... Good.
I'm impressed you got off with just a scratch! But next time, try to be more careful, okay?
I'll try. Thanks again, Vestal!
Are you plagued by bad luck too, Haruka?
Not really, I just trip a lot. I'm not particularly unlucky as a whole.
I suppose clumsiness and misfortune are not one and the same.

options.text: What happened? Untied shoelaces? Stray stone?

reply.text: Hmm good question... I don't think I stepped on anything, I simply tripped, just like that...

options.text: You're not hurt, are you?

reply.text: Nope, I'm fine! Sorry if I made you worry, Commander!

237.text: The girls here are all such good singers.

comments.text: You're a great singer chihaya! It's fun to sing along with you
Thank you. I'm just happy I got to teach you.
I liked the pictures in the book you showed
I'm glad you did. It's a cute little picture book for teaching children songs.
Sure sounds like fun! Can I join you for the next singalong?
Of course. As soon we all have time, let's do it.
Woohoo! ^^b
The little ones should all have good teachers like you. Hahaha.
I wouldn't say I'm the greatest teacher, but... I'm happy to have helped.

options.text: Aww, how cute.

reply.text: You think I'm cute...? Well, thank you, Commander.

238.text: I may have stirred a little too much...

comments.text: It takes more than a slight overstirring to make food start to smoke like that!
It is incredible in a way how thou even managed to flub so magnificently...
Look, nobody's perfect! Everyone messes up sometimes!
Contrary to my expectations, Miss Iori's dish actually proved quite delectable.
Of course it was! Why WOULDN'T my cooking be delectable?
Yeah. It tasted great, even though it looked like you-know-what.
No, I don't know what. Explain!

options.text: Thanks for the grub!

reply.text: You're welcome. Maybe I'll cook it again for you if you ask nicely.

239.text: You know what they say: two heads are always better than one!

comments.text: I felt much more productive while working with you, Ritsuko. Let's team up again sometime in the future.
Absolutely! If there's one thing this taught me, it's that paperwork is tough, whether you work at for agency or the navy.
It sure is. I'm glad to have someone as experienced as you helping with it.
If only I had a pair of glasses, then maybe I could be as smart as you two...
I don't think glasses have anything to do with smarts...
You know what else they say? Four eyes are smarter than two!
That's just a stereotype! Glasses don't make you smart!

options.text: In any case, you were a great help. Thanks!

reply.text: I'm glad to have been of assistance!

240.text: Check out my Proto Bulin cosplay! Ahem... bulin!

comments.text: I wanna cosplay too! Brb while I go ask around for a wrench to borrow!
Right on, pardner! Lessee whose tool is the best: the purple wrench, or the golden drill!
You're on! See you at noon, cowgirl!
New Bulin just dropped.
Don't go around causing trouble with that costume, okay, Ami?
I know, duh! Get off my case!

options.text: This is getting out of hand! Now there are 2 of them!

reply.text: Pretty on-point cosplay, right? Buliiiin!

241.text: Wow, Cleve! You're into growing bonsai too? That's awesome!

comments.text: Never thought I'd meet a fellow bonsai fan! :D Was so fun talking to you!
You wanna meet up tomorrow and gimme some protips on how to trim the leaves?
DO I? Heck yeah I do!
You can find friends in the strangest of places, I suppose.
Oh btw Iori, you wanna give bonsai-growing a try too? It'll be fun, I promise! ^^
Thanks, but I'll pass. Not my thing.

options.text: Cultivating friendships and plants at once. How nice!

reply.text: Yeah! We should totally throw a bonsai festival! You'd better be there too, Commander!

242.text: I made a new friend today.

comments.text: Kasumi is happy you've made new friends. Foo is happy, too.
Friends? As in several...?
UMM who is that you're looking at kasumi??
Foo's and Kasumi's new friend. By the way, our new friend says hello.
OH NO AM I CURSED NOW?! AFDSGDFSGF

options.text: Making new friends is always good.

reply.text: Absolutely. It's just, somehow I get the feeling Kasumi and I have met somewhere before...

243.text: Out on a morning jog! "Gotta go fast," as they say!

comments.text: This early? Although, the early bird gets the worm, I suppose.
Mhm! In this case, the early rabbit gets the carrots at the canteen!
Ah, a fellow morning jogger. Good to see a likeminded girl!
Jogger solidarity! :handshake:
Enjoy your jogs. Me, I'd rather sleep in...
You should give it a try sometime, Suruga! Exercising feels great and helps you stay in shape!
Thanks but I need to conserve my energy, not burn it all first thing in the morning.

options.text: Jogging in the nineties â™¬

reply.text: Nineties...? As in nautical miles per hour? I may be fast, but I'm not THAT fast, Commander!

244.text: Gaze in awe at what I, the full-fledged aircraft carrier Katsuragi, am capable of with my planes!

comments.text: butter my butt and call me a biscuit... impressive.
Right? This is what distinguishes a full-fledged aircraft carrier from ordinary light carriers!
Oh, to mount a plane and soar through the air... Wouldn't that be nice?
Yeah, looks sweet! I wanna have a go on it next!
My intuition tells me you probably shouldn't...

options.text: Now this is what peak performance looks like.

reply.text: It sure is! The kind of peak performance only the cream of the carrier crop can reach!

245.text: As it turns out, collecting all the amusement park stickers was pretty easy.

comments.text: Here we have it, nya. Picture proof that Chikuma did it first, nya!
I smell a scoop! Ahem... Chikuma, what was your trick to getting all the stickers so quickly?
Let's just say I did some preliminary intel-gathering~
I heard you win a prize if you get every sticker. Is this true?
Wuuut nobody said there'd be a prize!! Got caught up in errands earlier so maybe I just missed the news... Anyway what even is the prize?
It's not about the prize, it's about all the stickers you got along the way~

options.text: THAT was quick. Good job!

reply.text: Incidentally, how many have you got so far, Commander? Just curious, hehe.

options.text: Can you go get the last ones I need? Please?

reply.text: I'm afraid you'll have to do it yourself if you want to find out what the prize is, Commander! Sorry~

246.text: It's a nice day out today. The sea breeze is lovely, too.

comments.text: Wow look at all those seagulls! Dang they really like you huh umikaze
So it seems. Do you want to feed them breadcrumbs together?
Nah but thanks. They only ever seem to respond to you feeding them anyway...
Seagulls flying close to the sea's surface is a sign of sunny weather for the whole day.
So I've heard! The brilliant sun graces the port today.

options.text: Popular with the gulls, eh?

reply.text: Quite so. They're my dear little friends.

247.text: Aw shoot... Magic isn't easy as it looks after all...

comments.text: Practice makes perfect! I believe in you, Yamakaze!
Thanks for believing umikaze!! I'm gonna keep trying until I nail it!!
Maybe you could use magic to prank people... Mwahaha! Time to study witchcraft!
Magic and pranks are both a kind of trick, so there's bound to be potential for mischief!
Nooooo magic shouldn't be used to cause trouble!!

options.text: Looking forward to your magic show!

reply.text: Thanks! I promise you won't be disappointed!!

248.text: meats yum yum, shaved ice is delish, combine them and you get the king of all food!!

comments.text: I can't even imagine how that would taste...
Probably like frozen chunks of meat. Not even a dog would touch that...
I got severe brain freeze from eating too much at once...
Has it passed now, Shiratsuyu?
Mostly, but I still feel a bit cold in the noggin...

options.text: Guess we'll make some tomorrow then.

reply.text: for real?? you'd better make mine MEAT flavored!!

249.text: My Commander is going to ADORE this soup. The secret ingredient is... my love <3

comments.text: I bet it'd be better if I added a little bit of my bathwater from last night~
WHY YOU LITTLE...!!!
You can cook, Taihou? I never knew you were so multi-talented.
If my Commander wills it, I will pick up and master any craft in the name of our love <3
It looks great! I'd love to taste it myself!
Thank you, but its indescribable taste is only for my Commander to savor.
Maybe that's for the best...

options.text: Can't wait to try it.

reply.text: I assure you, you'll feel my love seep into your every tastebud, my Commander! <3<3

250.text: See the fish dance a fantastic dance! They've given me new inspiration!

comments.text: ooh, fish... bet they taste amazing grilled...
they better watch out for that shark. raaawr.
I can't comment on their taste, but I can say they're cute and worthy of preservation!
You're turning to the animal kingdom for new dance moves? Neato.
Would you want to see me practicing them?
Thanks but I'll pass. I'd be down to watch when you've nailed them tho.

options.text: Hope your practice is going swimmingly.

reply.text: Ahahah! Oh, you, Commander. It's going great! I promise you'll be amazed when you see it.

251.text: Check it out, we're having a picnic ^^

comments.text: Ain't nothing better than a comfy li'l picnic on a warm day!
Mhm! The weather couldn't be better for it~
Perfect time and weather for a small siesta...
now you're making me sleepyyyyy...
What a lovely day it was. I'm happy we could spend this day together.
Right? We should do it again sometime soon!
Oh, definitely. I'll make the lunches next time.

options.text: I couldn't have asked for better weather.

reply.text: Yeah! Not too hot, not too windy, and not too bright either!

options.text: Great cooking by the way, Michishio.

reply.text: I'm glad to hear you liked it!

252.text: Does this ship NEED to swing so much?! ><

comments.text: Get it together, Fortune! A true Royal Navy shipgirl does not panic from a mere amusement park ride!
Sorry? I'll try... not panicking I guess??
It's worth pointing out Her Highness declined having a go on the ride >_>
I believe we were asked not to disclose that fact, Edinburgh.
RIGHT UMM how do I delete the post? BEL PLEASE HELP ME HERE!
Wow... I was be too scared to board the pirate ship. You're brave, Fortune...
I only did because I didn't expect it would go so high and so fast... ><

options.text: Try familiarizing yourself with less intense rides first.

reply.text: Good idea, then I might just get used to it...

comments.text: What's the matter, Le Malin?! What happened?
One roller coaster too many...
Oh, I see... It's important to know your own limits.
Doesn't that just prove that you're out of shape?
No, it proves that the outside world sucks...

options.text: All good things in moderation, Le Malin.

reply.text: Yeah, I'll be enjoying good things moderately from the comfort of my room from now on...

254.text: This was more fun than I expected.

comments.text: Haha, somehow I just knew you'd like it the moment I laid eyes on it.
I even set a new record. That was nice.
Hmm. This could be worth trying out.
Let's bring Alabama and see who can score highest.
what a ripoff. it's just a punching bag with a score tracker.
But it's fun. We could play it together and see who's really strongest.
meh. another time maybe.

options.text: Wow. You really blew the last record out of the water.

reply.text: What can I say? I felt motivated because you were around, Commander.

255.text: You asked for them, and we listened! Come get your very own Ultra Cute Indy t-shirt!

comments.text: For goodness' sake, sis... You didn't have to make so many...
This is only the start, my beloved Indy! I'm not done until every person alive has an Indy tee!
You're giving them away, nya? Why not charge money for them, nya???
Because it's Indy promo merch! The point is to raise Indy awareness!
Is that really necessary though...

options.text: Ahem... Indy is soooo cute!

reply.text: Preach it, Commander! Louder for the people in the back!

256.text: Just discovered a new favorite treat!

comments.text: I'm glad we managed to get these. The bakery usually sells out pretty quick.
Mhm. I'd like to try another one of their breads next time!
I bet it tastes just as good as it looks!
It really does. I'll buy some for you too next time.
Whoa, really?! You're the best! Thanks!

options.text: I could go for some melon bread too.

reply.text: Well, in that case... I'll get you one the next time I'm at the bakery, Commander!

257.text: Is Oxy-cola carbonated? I can't handle that stuff...

comments.text: Carbonation is the least of your concerns. Only shipgirls can drink Oxy-cola.
Really? All right then...
Man I LOVE Oxy-cola! Nothing beats the feeling after you chug a whole bottle in one go!
Hard agree~ The fizzy feeling you get in your tummy is god-tier~
So... Safe to say it IS carbonated then?
Yeah lol? It's not meant for non-shipgirl consumption anyway, which sucks I know but what can you do

options.text: I'll get you a regular drink instead.

reply.text: Thanks, Commander. Just make sure it's not carbonated, all right?

258.text: Another masterpiece for my collection heheh

comments.text: Holy pog! We've got a sculpting prodigy among us~
FYI: That's high praise coming from Long Island, yes.
Deserved praise tbh. Tho credit where credit is due: she did provide me with quality refs.
Looking to strike a deal, nya? You make the figurines, I do the marketing, nya.
Good offer but nah, I don't do commissions.

options.text: Talk about professional-grade sculpting!

reply.text: I mean it literally is, but I'll take the dub

259.text: Brewing tea always clears my mind so good.

comments.text: You're a mighty cultured lady, Namiko.
Thank you for the green tea. It was wonderful.
Just happy to make use of what I learned from my school's tea ceremony club.
It's true what they say about not judging a book by its cover.
What's that supposed to mean?
Well, based on your mannerisms I thought you'd be more into sports...
Do come to our Royal Navy tea parties sometime if you wish to savour TRUE high-quality tea!
Hell yeah! I'll be there!

options.text: Great tea, would drink again.

reply.text: Glad you liked it! Stop by again if you're ever in the mood for more!

260.text: Brainstorming titles for my video. "Streamer Girl Ends Up in AL Universe" maybe.

comments.text: Getting used to life here, from the sound of it.
Uh-huh, so why not stream it while I can, right?
A fellow streamer? Subscribed~
Thanks! Subscribed back so we can be moots.
Darn, I didn't catch you live >.<
Don't sweat it, there's always next time. Remember to subscribe and hit the bell button for updates.

options.text: Great stream all around, Hass.

reply.text: Thanks! Appreciate your help with getting me set up.

comments.text: It's always so weird seeing pictures of myself... Even when other people take them.
why though? you look totally normal here
I dunno, it's just weird... Now I'm getting really self-conscious, ahaha...
crane give ya anything good? :D
We got two plushes. Well, specifically, Yume won them, and she gave me one.
i just got lucky really, happy to share the loot

options.text: The first of many new friends, I hope.

reply.text: wouldn't that be nice... thanks for introducing us, commander

262.text: Anyone tryna break the school rules will have ME to answer to!

comments.text: You're doing an exemplary job thus far as the temporary Student Council Rep, Chise.
It's only for a day so I gotta make it count! Haven't seen anyone break the rules so far tho...
The students here are rather well-behaved, so I wouldn't be surprised if there are no incidents today.
You're on the right side, friend! Together, we'll make the academy a bully-free zone!
Oh yeah totally! I'm all about that anti-bullying stuff.

options.text: Want to try being an honorary member for another club?

reply.text: Hell yeah! I wanna get a feel for all of 'em!

263.text: These "riggings" you have are very intriguing...

comments.text: Are you curious about Iron Blood riggings?
They resemble kaijus, how fascinating...
Interesting, are they not? I know the feeling, being something of a researcher myself.
I'm sure you see now why Iron Blood tech is the greatest in the world!
Perhaps. I will say with certainty that I'm intrigued.

options.text: Word of advice... just don't get too close.

reply.text: I can only surmise you learned that the hard way, Commander.

264.text: The lengths I gotta go to tame these little bastards...

comments.text: LOL are you holding a lecture for cats?
It's not a lecture, it's training. I've busted my ass getting these guys to warm up to me...
Geesh girl, sounds tough. Hang in there.
Ahh, this takes me back. What adorable creatures.
Adorable, maybe, but they won't follow my orders. I don't understand what I'm doing wrong.
You're doing nothing wrong. Cats simply follow only their own rules.
Just be genuine with them, and you'll all become closer!
There's no logical way that would work.

options.text: Seems the cats are having fun, at least.

reply.text: I suppose there's that, if nothing else.

265.text: Me? Miss leg day? Not a chance.

comments.text: preeetty sure there are better ways to train leg muscles.
Yeah but this way I get some fighting move practice too. Gonna be 3-stocking Sirens left and right.
ooh good point! I'll give that a try sometime myself!
Go for it girl.
Does this count as kickboxing? I wanna try, it looks fun!
You've gotta be careful or you'll hurt yourself. I can teach you the basics if you want.
That'd be awesome! Tell me all about it, coach!

options.text: It's nice working up a sweat from time to time.

reply.text: Hell yeah. And when you hit the showers after? That's the good stuff.

266.text: call me atlas cause the world rests on my shoulders

comments.text: Oh god I'm getting reverse(?) vertigo looking at this...
just tilt your head 180 degrees and it'll go away
lmao
Don't you get lightheaded if you hold that pose?
i only held it for 10 seconds to take a pic lol, but yeah hold it too long and you gon get dizzy
Every action has an equal and opposite reaction. Just as you shoulder the weight of the world, it shoulders YOUR weight.
damn thats deep

options.text: And what happens if you shrug?

reply.text: gravity kicks in and i get a bump on the head

267.text: Oopsie! Guess who's been a bad girl again!

comments.text: What did you do this time?
Rearranged all the books in random order! I'm so bad the devil tips his hat to me!
How devilish... At least it seems they're all still there.
Well obviously. I'm a bad girl, not a thief!
Teehee~ This gives me an idea for an even bigger prank!
You thinking what I'm thinking? Hiding behind the door then going BOO when the Commander comes in?
Or better yet: rigging firecrackers to go off when the door opens!
I might be bad but that idea is just evil!

options.text: Honestly, it's in a better state now than before. Thanks.

reply.text: WHAT?! DANG IT!

268.text: I'm having the time of my life with this big button!

comments.text: Despite the huge "don't push me" warning on it?
The warning only makes me wanna push it more!
Heheh, sounds like a rave review for our new stress relief button, nya. Time to mass-produce it, nya.
Ah, so it's just a stress toy. Very well, carry on, U-1206.
You're making more?! I'll take your entire stock!
Meh. Would have more appeal if it did something when you push it.
Good criticism. What if, for example, it set off a pack of explosives?
NO. U-1206 would raze the port in a minute flat

options.text: Very niche product... Not sure it'll catch on.

reply.text: You'd be amazed how fun it is! Give it a push and see for yourself!

269.text: Hope you're all hungry â€“ we're having norimaki tonight!

comments.text: Is it really proper to cut food with a katana?
You trying to say my swordsmanship is lacking?
No? The sword is the problem here, not your skill with it!
Never passing on a chance to train with your blade, eh... I should take notes.
Damn right. It's good for practicing holding your torso steady!
For god's sake! Please just use a knife like a normal person!

options.text: Swords aside, those norimakis were fantastic.

reply.text: Of course they were! My cooking skills are second to none!

270.text: Need to polish until they're sparkling clean...

comments.text: That's an incredible tower of glasses in the background!
I think you only had to place them on the table... Is this a flex? >_>
Honestly, I didn't notice. The tower kind of built itself.
I envy your ability to concentrate. I'd probably get distracted and drop a glass at some point ><
You could always do concentration training... I suppose?
Really? Is that a thing?
Not sure, but I think so.

options.text: Flex or not, really well done, Penelope.

reply.text: Are you that impressed? Well, thank you. I'm glad to hear it.

271.text: Time to make an important choice! Quick! Red drink, or blue drink?

comments.text: Lemme guess, you spiked em both? Not fooling me~
Nuh-uh! No cheap tricks (this time), they're both 100% ordinary fruit juice!
Is choosing both an option?
Nope. It's one or none, sis!
That's a tough one, Morpheus...
Hehehe~ All I'm offering is a drink, nothing more~
Hmm... Simply not choosing is always an option, isn't it?

options.text: Red drink.

reply.text: Interesting... You're a go-getter, ain'tcha? Here ya go, one glass of strawberry juice!

options.text: Blue drink.

reply.text: Blue, huh... Fancy yourself a thinker, do you? Here ya go, one glass of blueberry juice!

272.text: Latte art is hard, but I'm giving it my best shot!

comments.text: Is that a cannon firing shells? Geesh, you're going all-out.
My initial plan was to make something more elegant, but it was too elaborate, so I settled for this.
Very on-brand motif, I'd say.
Thank you...? I suppose latte art is a reflection of its artist too, haha.
it sucks how short-lived latte art is... you can make a masterpiece, then it's gone after one sip (ï¼›ä¸€_ä¸€)
True... But it's also a shame to let it go to waste. Food art is still food and should be consumed!

options.text: Bravo! You're a prodigy at this stuff.

reply.text: Please, you flatter me, Commander. It's nothing compared to what pros can make!

273.text: Tip: if the Commander's in crunch mode and you're brewing tea, pour it into a thermos so it stays warm for longer.

comments.text: I'm so doing this from now on. You're so smart, Choukai.
It's quite simple really, but thank you!
I would've never thought of that... If it's that simple then I guess I'm stupid.
Don't be so hard on yourself, Maya. You notice lots of things I easily overlook.
A wise idea. Nobody likes a cup of cold tea, after all.
What about ice tea? Still, I know what you mean.
Room-temperature tea then. The bane of both ice tea and regular tea enthusiasts!

options.text: It's so much better when warm. Thanks a bunch.

reply.text: You're welcome, Commander! Remember to take regular breaks and stay hydrated.

274.text: Hehe... I pull off the "master strategist" look quite well, don't I?

comments.text: "A heroic stature, a wave of feathered fan. With a word and a smile, comes a flawless plan."
If Chen Hai is the tactician, then I'll be the fearless general! "A thousand challenges, a thousand victories!"
An unpredictable military tactician with no shortage of stratagems... Indeed, that does fit Chen Hai's personality well.
My, you flatter me~
The feathered fan has practically become a motif for strategists and tacticians, huh? I've seen it in all sorts of books and movies.
Indeed. The striking image of the original master strategist captured the hearts and imaginations of countless generations~

options.text: It feels like we can defeat any foe with you on our side.

reply.text: Haha, naturally. Shall I advise you on some strategies over tea?

275.text: Investigation in progress! The mysteries of this port will soon be brought to light!

comments.text: woah, it's pitch dark... where the heck are you?
Secrets always lurk in the darkness, away from peoples' prying eyes! Muahaha
Oh, you're over at the academy, huh. Have you tried turning on the lights?
NO! THERE'S NOTHING TO INVESTIGATE IN THE LIGHT!
Oh, Chang Chun said that there's a ghost lurking in the academy. Were you looking for that as well? You should've brought me with you!
err, about that... actually you know what, that seems fun. if you're going, I'll come along too
Huh?! Wait, so the Seven Mysteries of the Academy are actually true?! We're gonna have to form an Occult Investigation Club, pronto!

options.text: So, uh, how's the investigation going?

reply.text: I've obtained irrefutable proof that... walking around the academy at night is kinda fun

276.text: Heeeey, who wants to get their ears cleaned next~

comments.text: I love seeing my friends all comfy and relaxed, hehe~
I'm glad you understand~ To heal others is to heal yourself~
Your technique... is way too good.
Hehe, I'm glad I could satisfy you, Dido~
I also have to master that wonderful technique of yours, and then...
I wouldn't mind teaching you. Slowly and gently~

options.text: I like what's going on here.

reply.text: Hehe... Master, seeing your satisfied expression is the best healing I can ask for~

277.text: So fluffy... it feels like I'm actually floating!

comments.text: Woah... What's this made of? It's like someone grabbed a cloud straight out of heaven...
I'm actually practicing for the banquet performance
Hehe... The background set I picked out for you looks even better than expected
Yes, I'm so grateful to everyone who helped prepare the set and this outfit as well!
the dry ice machine Akashi lent me is super nifty as well~
I'm here to lend a helping paw, nya~! Just remember to swing by the shop every now and then, nya~

options.text: I'm really looking forward to your performance!

reply.text: Oh wow... I'll do my best!

278.text: No Dragon Empery festival is complete without a resplendent red that lights up your life.

comments.text: wait a sec... that's gonna light up your insides
I assure you, the flavors are to die for. I've cooked plenty for you and Ying Swei as well, so make sure to swing by to grab some~
Aww, you're too kind. I'll be over in a bit to bring some over to Chao Ho.
uhhhhh...
Sis, I know you're good at cooking, but you sometimes go a little overboard...
Yeah... More like flavors that'll kill you...
Don't worry, everyone. I assure you, you won't even be able to taste the spice~
oh yeah, the guests are totally gonna love this 233
Really? It's that good? I want to try it too!

options.text: Alright, that WAS good... until the kick set in.

reply.text: I made more than enough for everyone, Commander. Feel free to come back for seconds~

279.text: Beautiful flowers may bloom in any season

comments.text: The wintersweet should be blossoming about now, right?
Miss Aurora, are you also a flower enthusiast? I've taken lots and lots of photos, and would be glad to share some with you!
Thank you for the photos! They're so pretty!
I passed by a few days ago, and the branches only had tiny little buds. Now look how gorgeous the flowers are...
A flower that blooms in the frigid winter... Quite a poetic imagery of tenacity and loneliness.
Life and beauty spring from even the harshest times. I think this flower represents a wonderful life lesson.

options.text: That's deep. Here I was waiting for spring to come.

reply.text: Of course. Let's enjoy spring's wondrous sights and scents together as well!

280.text: The aroma of these herbs is quite unlike anything from back home.

comments.text: I heard you're supposed to boil all of these together into a really bitter decoction.
Indeed. As they say in the Dragon Empery, "a good medicine tastes bitter."
Wh-what if I don't like bitter things...
Did you know that the Dragon Empery has a variety of delicious dishes that incorporate medicinal herbs?
Ah yes, medicinal cooking! I've heard much about it, but haven't had a chance to try it myself yet.
Maybe we could ask our friends on how to get started.
A splendid idea!

options.text: Perfect, I haven't been feeling 100% lately...

reply.text: Unfortunately, I don't know how to prescribe herbal formulas... But, I'd be more than glad to give you some bedside care...

options.text: Just stay healthy, and you won't need to drink that stuff.

reply.text: Staying healthy is easier said than done though. Speaking of which, shall I bring some herbal tea to bolster your stamina?

281.text: SSR equipment GET. Time to climb the leaderboards, yes.

comments.text: What a lucksack. Give the ghost some luck too.
The legendary gamer L.I. can clear all the content without this
Sure, but, I live to see those loot beams.
Then... I hope you get lucky soon and get your drops, yes.
Meh, good enough
ayanommmy come carry me pls! I'm totally stuck on this stage
Just select me from the support menu. Also, you still have to grind up your upgrade mats so you stop getting 1-shot.
oh, i see. thank you, ayaya~

options.text: Congrats on the drop!

reply.text: Thanks, Commander. You should play too, yes.

282.text: A Dragon Empery legend goes... there once was a person who could split the tip of a halberd from a great distance. Bet I could do that too!

comments.text: Wow, Pennsylvania is so cool!
Not as cool as your flashy spear techniques! There's a lot we can learn from each other!
Sounds like a good idea, heehee~
Woah, you actually did it... Can't believe you landed the shot from so far away.
Haha... Well, you know how many times I failed before I could land this one shot?
Well done... But think you can pierce a willow branch in two from a hundred paces?
Ahaha! That's just bullying now...

options.text: You've got terrific form!

reply.text: Oh, Commander, wanna give it a try as well? It'll be fun, and you might learn something new!

options.text: First horseback riding, now this. You seem to be able to do anything!

reply.text: Heh. Nothing's impossible - you just have to work hard for it!

283.text: I'm unstoppable! Who wants a piece of me?

comments.text: woah, your spear technique is so cool... think you could teach me?
No way! You're already like a bat out of hell. And I'm not giving that bat a spear.
"A flourish of a white spear below, a flurry of pink petals above." A truly poetic scenery.
Hehe... It's still kinda embarrassing when you bust out the poetry while talking about me...
Splendid form. I've learned a thing or two about the art of the spear recently. How about we spar?
Haha, the flower spears I use for operas aren't the same as the spears you use for fighting~

options.text: Oh, so you were rehearsing for a new show?

reply.text: Naw, just doing it to get the blood pumping. Wouldn't want to get rusty, y'know~

284.text: Trust is the currency and information is the commodity!

comments.text: What did you put in that envelope?!
Just some of my musings on naval tactics, for the Commander to read. Relax, comrade!
That's all? Good...
I saw it! With my own two eyes!
Saw what, hmm?
The Commander retrieving the envelope...
You mean... before it even got sent off?
Wow! The Commander must have some sort of sixth sense when it comes to this.

options.text: I got the files. Good stuff!

reply.text: Wonderful!

options.text: You could've just given them to me directly.

reply.text: A good intel broker should always employ unexpected means!

285.text: I drew some stuff... How does it look?

comments.text: Aww, how adorable. You've got artistic talent, Kiev.
Thanks... I could do better, but there's a limit to what you can draw with condensation...
Cute. I like making window doodles on cold days too.
We could doodle together sometime... if you want?
Sure! We'll make the best window art the world's ever seen!
Not sure I'm good enough to make world-class art but... I'd be happy to try.

options.text: Love these doodles. Keep them coming.

reply.text: I love them too. I'll try to make some more.

286.text: Dinner's ready! Come help yourself to my special borscht!

comments.text: Don't mind if I do!
Also I threw in a bunch of hearty veggies I'm sure you'll love~
Uhhhhh... this isn't like any borscht I've had before.
I'll say this: it's got flavor. Like a whole pantry mixed together.
So it's no good? Aww... Maybe I shouldn't have added all those leftover ingredients...

options.text: Perfect timing! I'm starving.

reply.text: Have as much as you like! Next time I'll cook a bigger batch just for you~

287.text: Ahhahahaah! Come here boy! You're long due for an extensive upgrade!

comments.text: Leave the poor thing be. Can't you see he's shaking?
Yeah, shaking with excitement for his makeover!
Be gentle with him, okay? Riggings have feelings too!
Worry not, I'm the most gentle genius mechanic on the planet!
Rebuild, eh? I wanna see what you can do.
My workshop is open to spectators!

options.text: Could you retrofit the fleet while you're at it?

reply.text: The whole fleet?! That's a tall order, but give me enough time and I can make it happen!

288.text: Vodka is only one solution to a cold winter. Tea is just as valid.

comments.text: Placidly drinking tea in such frigid weather... What a striking image! I shall replicate this feat!
I think I'll pass... just looking at this pic makes me shudder -.-;
Don't dis it before you try it. Drinking hot tea amid gentle snowfall is an experience.
Nope, tea doesn't cut it. Vodka or go home!
Face it, sometimes tea hits the spot in a way vodka doesn't.

options.text: Tea sounds nice, but I'm not sure I want to go outside...

reply.text: Put on a coat and I'm sure you'll be fine.

289.text: Guess who just completed her 20th task today!!!

comments.text: Incredible, Captain Pompey! You set a shining example for us all, me especially, to follow.
20 is a staggering number... I'll need to redouble my efforts.
Hahah! Keep at it and you'll be as great as Captain Pompey one day!
Geesh, that's a ton... Don't you ever get tired?
Not when I receive boatloads of recognition to keep me going all day!
Must be nice being so motivated... or awful being so desperate for clout.

options.text: Keep up the good work, Captain Pompey.

reply.text: Will do! Speaking of work, got any new tasks for me?

290.text: I'll never tire of Sardegnian cuisine. It's simply the best.

comments.text: I know one thing more appetizing than our cuisine. You, signora.
Always with the pickup lines... On a more serious note, would you like to join me at our next dinner party?
Would I like to? I would LOVE to.
Fact. I had some pineapple pizza the other day and I now believe in Sardegnian culinary supremacy~
Same ngl. A while ago I tried chocolate spaghetti. I know, it sounds really sus, but it's actually good shit.
Letting the Eagle Union adopt our food was a mistake.

options.text: Sardegnian food is up there as some of the best.

reply.text: You have excellent taste, Commander. Unlike some people who'd desecrate our beloved food.

291.text: Shower thought: if there are crop circles on earth, shouldn't there be cows on the moon

comments.text: there should be shrooms up there too...
Shrooms? You lost me
on the dark side of the moon... because well, mushrooms grow in dark and barren places...
Hmm that's a good point actually
I know for a fact there are bunnies on the moon!
Really huh? Wonder if it has enough shrooms to sustain an always-growing rabbit population

options.text: Let's not forget the moon is made of cheese.

reply.text: This explains everything... cows made the moon from milk, shrooms grow on the cheese, and the cows and rabbits live on the cheese and shrooms

292.text: Stop scrolling Juustagram and come join me outside! This weather is too good to pass on!

comments.text: I'm on my way. Should I bring my bike so we can race?
Race? While an amusing proposition, that's not exactly my idea of a leisurely time.
Now's the perfect time to admire the cherry blossoms in bloom too.
Excellent idea! I'll cook some food so we can have a picnic.
I concur. This is more in line with what I had in mind.
Oh, okay! I'll bring the blanket!
Now that you mention it, this weather would be ideal for an outdoor tea party.
Indeed it is. I can smell the biscuits already.

options.text: I'll go touch grass too after work.

reply.text: You certainly should. We'll reserve a spot on the picnic blanket for you.

293.text: Thank you lord for filling the 8th desdiv with girls this cute aaaa I LOVE Y'ALL SO MUCH

comments.text: Somehow you sound even more giddy than normal...
Can't help it! Y'all are just so darn adorable in your school outfits and I had to snap pictures of em~
Is that why you called us all together? To take photos?
It's nice to all get together and do things sometimes though, isn't it?
Who doesn't love a group photo? Speaking of, we from the 6th DesDiv should assemble and take one too!
hey yeah! I'll go pick up inazuma and ikazuchi in a sec
Be sure to give em cute clothes to wear~

options.text: Aww, look at them. They're so sweet.

reply.text: Right? They're all as cute as a button and sweet as a pastry~

options.text: You're the cutest one though, Ooshio.

reply.text: Aww you're making me blush~

294.text: Lol just how many filters does this app have

comments.text: Yo, what app is this? I wanna try it for myself.
It's called Yassify, really good for touching up selfies and stuff.
Thanks! I'll mess around with it and post something later.
No problem~ I'll keep an eye on my feed heh.
Never mind selfies, imagine what it can do with photos of OTHER people~!
Omg you're right, you could mess with someone's face in hilarious ways~

options.text: Hah, that's cute.

reply.text: Thanks~ By the way, you wanna meet up today for a lil *special* photoshoot~?

options.text: Heh, that's funny.

reply.text: Yea lol I look like a sakura empire submarine

295.text: Oh, Emden, what shall your next move be, hmm?

comments.text: TIL people still play chess (tabletop chess at that) in current year
It's quite enjoyable, actually. There is a reason it's been around for centuries. Won't you give it a try?
eh, maybe one day
It seems another worthy opponent has appeared... I, Valiant, challenge you to a game of chess!
Challenge accepted. Emden shall be waiting for you in the library.
Are you playing against yourself? You do you, but you'd learn more by playing another opponent.
"That is exactly what Emden's doing."

options.text: We should clearly do a port chess tournament.

reply.text: Good idea, my darling human. Emden shall seize the title of Grandmaster.

296.text: randomly went to this pastry shop and got their weekly special. it was simply *chef's kiss*

comments.text: That shop's really famous. They have a new special every week, and it always sells out fast.
wow really? pretty lucky i managed to get some then
We must be quick if we're to try it for ourselves! Spee, meet me outside!
hey no rush, i've bought some for you girls too
I'm curious to try one. Are there any left?
nope i already snagged all they had but if you want one, come get it
For free? How generous. Save a seat at the table for me.

options.text: Can confirm and would recommend.

reply.text: awesome you could join us, commander. let's go looking for some nice shops together sometime

297.text: Sigh... Every time I bring my umbrella, expecting rain, it always turns sunny.

comments.text: the weather's random like that. don't let it get to you
I'm not *too* bothered since this happens every single time, but still...
Sunshine is nice, so what's the problem? Frankly, I'd be glad.
The problem is, it's proof that nothing ever goes as I wished. It's my curse...
If what you say is true, you should wish for the opposite of what you want. Have you tried that?
Yes, I have. Good things always come to those I wish misfortune upon...

options.text: Don't weep! Smile for me and outshine the sun.

reply.text: Thanks, Commander... You're too kind to worthless old me. I hope... you'll face terrible misfortune from now on.

298.text: I claim the depot. Henceforth it shall be known as the independent republic of Yorcktown.

comments.text: whoa new country just dropped. ruled by a shipgirl too!
I'm kidding, of course. Me and the manjuus are just reorganizing the shelves.
laaame. i wanted to defect so i won't have to do work
Thanks, nya. I owe you bigtime for this, nya.
Don't thank me, thank the diligent manjuus. They did all the work.

options.text: Stellar work, Yorck! I knew I could count on you.

reply.text: Please, it was nothing. Besides, it's my pleasure to carry out your orders.

299.text: Everything happens for a reason. Don't intervene with nature.

comments.text: Are you sure? Their screws are flying loose...
They're built to take a serious beating. This damage only amounts to a scratch for them.
Thank you for reassuring me, ThÃ¼ringen... I panicked when Fishy pounced a fellow rigging.
Boys will be boys. All is fine as long as it doesn't get ugly.
omg I'm so sorry!! eisen's usually a good boy, I don't know what got into him!
Oh it's no big deal! The whole thing just surprised me, that's all.

options.text: Oh dear. Was anyone hurt?

reply.text: Nope, no injuries. I made sure of that.

options.text: Status report. How are the riggings?

reply.text: Only minor damage. A few repairs and they'll be as good as new.

300.text: I've completed my patrol of the port. Nothing suspicious to report!

comments.text: Feels great pulling the reins, doesn't it?
Affirmative. My steed was also very trusty, which helped greatly.
Soon we'll have enough horse riders to form a port cavalry corp.
Hmm... While I do like that idea, we should pass it by the Commandant first.
I've rode piggyback, I wanna try horseback next!
Those are two very different things, I'm afraid.
Well, both involve pulling the reins of something. Or someone. Heheh.

options.text: You look awesome riding horseback.

reply.text: Thank you for the compliment! I have long to go before I master the art of riding, however.

options.text: Excellent work! You make me proud.

reply.text: You flatter me, Commandant! I am only doing my duty.

301.text: If you wish to see the Commander during office hours, you must first book an appointment.

comments.text: Living up to your name, I see.
Just doing my job as a palace guard!
What if I have urgent business?
I'm sure you can gain permission to enter if you explain the situation.
To do that, we need to see the Commander first, don't we?
That's why you book an appointment. JK, I'll relay your message in times like that.

options.text: Do I need to book an appointment too?

reply.text: If you want to. You make the rules.

options.text: Keep up the good work.

reply.text: Of course, but I do want to sortie sometime soon. Standing guard all day is a bit boring.

302.text: Sod going outside on my day off. I'll be relaxing in my room instead.

comments.text: But there are so many fun things you can do outside!
Fun though they may be, they're draining. Holidays are a time to recover your energy, not spend it all.
It must've been a tiresome week for you. I say you should spend your day however you please.
See? Illustrious gets it.
Then how about we listen to some music? That's a pleasant activity one can still do indoors.
hey wanna pop into the napping club and catch some z's with the gang
Napping club? That doesn't sound half-bad...

options.text: Enjoy your time off. You've earned it.

reply.text: Thank you, Commander. The next time we're both free, you should join me so we can laze around together.

303.text: I've finished caring for the little cat. She'll be fine, it was just a scratch.

comments.text: glad to hear it! i was sooo worried when i found her limping!! thanks for patching her up ('â—‡')ã‚ž
Don't mention it. It's my job to help the wounded, be they shipgirl, animal, or human.
Did you make sure it's not infected...?
I applied a dash of antiseptic. The wound will heal in no time.
Excellent work, Doctor Jarvis. You make me proud~
You flatter me, Vestal. I can only dream of one day helping people as much as you do.
Aww, don't be so humble. You're outstanding in your own regard!

options.text: I'm so glad healthcare is free at this port.

reply.text: It's one of the perks of being in the navy. If you ever need treatment, come see me, Commander.

options.text: That's a cute E collar you gave her.

reply.text: It's a little flashy, but it does its job. That's all that matters.

304.text: I think I'll go with this pair today.

comments.text: Goodness, you have so many gloves. Are they all spares?
All spares. A Royal Knight must dress her best both inside and out. That's why I keep a stockpile of spares, just in case.
I can only imagine how much time it takes to launder all those...
It's a huge chore indeed. When a pair gets too dirty or damaged, it's faster to just replace it.
Discarded and replaced... The same will happen to me if I become too dirty...
Please, you shouldn't liken yourself to a pair of gloves. You're better than that.
An impressive collection. But do you have a dueling gauntlet, Bellona? I challenge you for your star chips!
Huh? If it's a duel you're issuing, I accept. What shall we use? Swords? Guns?

options.text: So THAT'S the secret to your elegance.

reply.text: It's far from the only component of it, but it certainly plays a part.

options.text: Is there ever a time the gloves come off?

reply.text: Haha! Yes, my liege. In love and war.

305.text: Seems this Royal Knight is in quite the hurry today!

comments.text: Please pardon my unbecoming stride! I was in a rush to deliver those documents to the Commander!
No need to apologise. Sometimes one must charge ahead at full speed.
So that's who I heard running down the corridor just earlier...
Sorry if I disturbed you! It won't happen again!
Heh I nearly bumped into her on the way. Maybe next time!
What, were you TRYING to headbutt her? Behave, Glowworm!

options.text: You were just in time. Thanks for the help.

reply.text: It's my pleasure being of assistance!

306.text: The night's put me in the mood for a glass or two.

comments.text: Just don't get wasted! I am NOT gonna carry you back to your room again!
Aww, are you worried I'll have too much? Consider joining me then. Drinking together is much more fun.
Who said I was WORRIED about you? I just don't wanna deal with the aftermath! And I don't feel like drinking tonight!
Heheh~ You really get easier to tease as the years go on.
Drinking in moderation now and then is fine. Just don't have too much.
It's only a glass or two, like I said.
girl you have a history of having way too much lmao

options.text: That was a great time. Looking forward to the next one.

reply.text: Hehe, next time's going to be even better. You'll see~

307.text: What in the seven seas happened to this place?! I'm expected to clean all this?!

comments.text: Must have been the storm that blew through yesterday. What a terrible mess.
I thought as a temp maid I'd only be sweeping floors!
Well... Think of it as a learning opportunity. You'll walk away with good experience.
Apologies for my delayed response. I have sent someone there to assist you.
I appreciate the help, though I never said I couldn't do it all on my own...

options.text: Good lord. Do you need a hand with that?

reply.text: I'll manage... Nothing I can't fix with a little elbow grease!

308.text: I tried my hand at making Dragon Empery-style cookies for the occasion!

comments.text: My, Howe. This is an incredible level of detail.
It's not my finest work, but I enjoyed making them. I must credit Aurora for providing me with references.
You're welcome. They turned out gorgeous, I have to say.
This is much more in line with what a fortune cookie should be. Well done!
Thank you. I hope I succeeded in capturing the Dragon Empery spirit.
They taste as good as they look! Thanks for giving me some!
I'm glad you liked them.

options.text: It feels like a crime eating something so picturesque...

reply.text: Letting them go to waste would be an even bigger crime, no? I can make more whenever you'd like, Commander.

309.text: Meh. This cup's too small for my liking. Lemme chug.

comments.text: That's the thing about tea, you're meant to savor the aroma and drink it in small sips!
Oh. That goes against everything I'm used to though.
you really shouldn't chug piping hot tea unless you want second degree burns in your throat.
That's a price I'm willing to pay. Chugging is a way of life.
Boil another pot of tea and I'll fetch some canteens! Let's see who can chug faster!
Yikes, even I know this sounds like a bad idea!
Seriously, this is NOT something you should try at home!

options.text: I'd listen to the Empery girls if I were you.

reply.text: Aww. All I want is to live free and chug...

options.text: Let's get you something more chuggable.

reply.text: You'll do that? Thanks, Comrade Commander!

310.text: Thanks to Chiyoda for styling my hair for the banquet. And sis, sorry it took so long.

comments.text: Don't be sorry! I can't let your silky hair look anything less than perfect on such a big day.
Was it really worth your whole morning, though?
Every minute spent combing through each strand was worth it!
aww it's sweet seeing sisters as close as you
If you ever want me to do your hair, just say it, sis.
wouldn't it be the other way around though. are you sure you know how to do someone else's hair
I mean... I can practice it! That's why I'm offering!

options.text: Looking forward to seeing it later today.

reply.text: I can't wait for everyone to see my work. You're gonna love it!

311.text: I've decided to pick up a new instrument.

comments.text: That's what you're up to? Aww, I thought we could have a girls' night out today...
This will take a while, sorry. We'll have to save it for another time.
Hmph... Fine. If you don't have time for a meetup, perhaps I'll bring the meetup to you!
How pleasant. Learning an instrument is both a good pastime and a way to become more cultured.
You should practice one yourself, sister. You'd surely become proficient in no time.
Maybe so. I will give it some thought.

options.text: Your performance was great. Keep it up!

reply.text: Thanks for stopping by to listen. I still have much practice to do before I master the flute, however.

312.text: I dedicate this performance to the Commander~

comments.text: So you were the source of that tempestuous symphony... I should've expected no less.
Thank you! I'm glad you think my piece was characteristic of me.
It was certainly shocking. I never thought a piano could produce such sounds.
It all comes down to the player's heart. You get what you put in.
That is a fascinating glimpse into your mind.

options.text: All I'll say is it left me speechless.

reply.text: That's exactly what I was going for~

313.text: I've been told hiding your mouth with a fan looks graceful. I feel a little naked, though...

comments.text: Not every day you see Boise without the mask.
I mean, it's improper to wear one to a banquet. Plus, this fan works well enough...
Good points. I'll say, it makes you look pretty.
The fan suits you well. There's nothing to be embarrassed about.
Thank you for the compliment...
Helena's right. You've got such cute looks, and no reason to hide them.
I do... But thank you...

options.text: That's a pretty pattern on it.

reply.text: Mhm. I think it's really nice.

options.text: You look stunning.

reply.text: Thank you...

314.text: This will be my first banquet, and I'm so tense... Need to look sharp!

comments.text: Take it easy. A knight must face all situations calmly and head-on!
You're right! I need to look sharp, but I can't lose my composure.
I've got some advice for how to destress if you need it
You do? By all means, let's hear it!
It's easy, just say screw the banquet and find a place you can be alone and veg out
That's not a solution! That's just skipping out on my duties!

options.text: Deep breaths. Take some time to mentally prepare.

reply.text: I will! I'll form a plan for the evening and try to follow it!

options.text: You look great. You've got nothing to worry about.

reply.text: That makes me feel a little more confident in myself. Thank you, Commander!

315.text: I think I've gotten completely lost in this mirror maze! Send help!

comments.text: Next time, trace the wall like I showed and you'll eventually find the way out.
Thank you for rescuing me! I'd never have made it out without you, Suruga!!
Don't mention it. Just be careful from now on.
How? The maze isn't particularly big.
Seeing myself reflected in all directions made me lose my bearings...
I'm terribly sorry the maze put you through such distress. I should have exercised foresight.
Don't be sorry! People getting lost in your maze is proof that it's a well-designed maze, after all!

options.text: How long were you lost in there?

reply.text: Not for too long, thanks to Suruga! The white rabbit was shown the way home!

316.text: Am I really supposed to just... lie here to play my role?

comments.text: Unless I'm mistaken, aren't you meant to play Red Riding Hood, not the Sleeping Beauty?
Le Malin said this is the best way to "get in touch with my vulnerable side," so...
Looking good! God I wish my rehearsals were as laid-back as yours... Anyway! Keep it up! Your role is important!
Of course! I shall put my nose to the grindstone!
I see your rehearsal is going well. I look forward to the live performance.
Hmph! You're no match for me, wolf!
I don't believe Little Red Riding Hood fares well against the wolf in the original story. Nevertheless, the live performance will surely be interesting.

options.text: You're not worried about dozing off?

reply.text: Hah! I am not so easily pacified by cozy cushions and warm sheets!

317.text: May I interest anyone in a juicy, shiny red apple?

comments.text: Hang on, isn't this that killer apple? One bite and you're worm food!
If so, then I fear Snow White may no longer be with us...
If this were a fairy tale, you'd be right. This apple, however, is ordinary in every way save for its excellent flavor.
Since you'll be playing Snow White, perhaps an adjustment to the script is in order.
You think so? What sort of change are you proposing?
