How about... Snow White takes the Seven Dwarves with her, rescues the prince, and brings down judgment upon the wicked queen?
Well... It's not a bad idea per se.

options.text: It may not kill you, but does it put you to sleep?

reply.text: Oh? Do you wish to play the part of the princess waiting for her Prince Charming to save her?

318.text: A wolf must be patient and strike only when the time is right.

comments.text: But in the last moment, Little Red Riding Hood escapes by the skin of her teeth?
All I'll say is that, when my prey enters my sights, the outcome is sure to be quite one-sided.
you know, it never sat right with me how some versions of the story end. no way in hell would a little girl survive an encounter with a damn wolf.
Sure, she wouldn't in real life. But in a tale with a story to tell, it's fair game! Right?
I'm not scared of you, wolf! I'll make a fur coat out of you!
sounds like little red riding hood here won't go down without a fight... that's what I like to see.
We shall see if the hunter doth become the hunted, come the live performance. Until then... Heehee.

options.text: It'll be a while before she arrives. Try to stay awake.

reply.text: A determined wolf does not rest for one minute until it has achieved its goal.

319.text: "What's in a name? That which we call a rose, by any other name would smell as sweet."

comments.text: Reciting your lines, I presume?
Yup. I've been rehearsing both the male and female leads, but I'm still not sure which I wanna play in the end, lol.
That is incredible, Biloxi! Meanwhile, I'm having enough trouble memorizing just ONE set of lines...
My advice: try to really, really immerse yourself into your role. Then memorizing your lines should become a breeze.
Ooh! So simple, yet so brilliant! Thank you, I'll be sure to give it a try!

options.text: You still need someone to play the other role, don't you?

reply.text: Are you interested in being that someone, Commander? Then do you wanna be Romeo... or Juliet? Heh.

options.text: Can't wait for the live performance!

reply.text: I promise you're not gonna be disappointed.

320.text: I will admit I am quite particular when it comes to props.

comments.text: Props, no pun intended, to the Royal Maids for helping set the stage!
No need to thank me, I was only doing my job. Besides, it was rather enjoyable.
We owe every successful play to the countless people who work hard behind the scenes.
Yup! Let's take a moment to appreciate the unsung heroes of the theatric world!
You're a right talented lass, Enterprise. Maid work and stage dressing are child's play for you, eh?
Please, my skills are middling at best. Everyone else deserves more praise than me.

options.text: Great job setting the stage!

reply.text: It's my pleasure, Master. You deserve praise as well for your part in making everything come together.

comments.text: Behold, the (prototype) Vroomulator Chariot! Custom-made for Roma by yours truly!
A prototype, you say? I cannot wait to see what the finished version is capable of.
I guarantee you it won't disappoint!
What are you doing atop a chariot?
Spreading our splendor across the port!
Ah, how magnificent. Keep it up.
That's a hell of a way to repurpose some motorcycles... Maybe I'll make my own silver chariot.
Throw me a DM if you want a hand with that! I can do whatever custom job you want!

options.text: Thanks for patrolling around port.

reply.text: It's all part of the job. Coupled with the splendor-spreading, it was two birds with one stone.

options.text: Now that's the splendor people clamor for!

reply.text: Ahah. Riding a chariot is a supreme joy. Would you like to ride with me sometime, Commander?

322.text: Check out my latest invention! I call it the Doggo Cattron 3000!

comments.text: What does it do?
It's a robot pet designed for people who love cats and dogs equally! This little kitty goes woof-woof!
So it's like... a dog with the body of a cat? Neato.
Fascinating! What's the internal structure like? I need to know!
You can examine it all you want if you help me with some ideas I've yet to implement! Deal?
Deal!
You've made a cat that's not a cat?
Bingo! What are your thoughts about that?
It's uh... weird? I don't get the point of it?
Alas, the world is not yet ready. But you'll see the appeal before long!

options.text: I want one so badly.

reply.text: Then I'll make a Kitty Dogbot variant just for you, Commander!

323.text: You know what complements a cozy afternoon? Tea with pastries, what else!

comments.text: Just like a nice afternoon is made even better with cake, a nice cake is made even better with warm tea.
It sure is. You Royal Navy ladies definitely know your stuff when it comes to afternoon tea.
I'm humbled. Our doors are open for you if you'd like to personally attend one of our tea parties.
I'd be right happy to.
What is that huge stack of papers?
Fear not, sis. This paperwork is due this evening.
Enjoying tea while you have this much unfinished work is incredibly poor conduct in this dignitary's eyes.
Relax, I'm just having a break. I'll get it done in a flash afterward.

options.text: It's all about working hard but not too hard.

reply.text: Well said! Breaks are a must to prevent burnout.

324.text: I make a habit of taking notes whenever I see something new in nature.

comments.text: Lookout, give me a report! What have you seen?
Some gorgeous valleys, trees, and lakes, to start with.
Aww man! I wish I could go on vacation too!
A vacation? I'm not sure hikes qualify as vacations.
Hikes are fun though! And you get to see new things and places, just like on a vacation!
I see... I suppose you could call it a micro-vacation.

options.text: Let's find some new vistas together next time!

reply.text: Sure, that'd be great.

325.text: Extra, extra, read all the hottest happenings in the latest edition of the Port Journal!

comments.text: At last! I'll have one copy.
Sold! Thanks for your patronage!
What kind of happenings? You know what, I'll have one too!
Probably not the kind you think, Libeccio.
This thing is loaded with things I never knew... Guess I've got a rival in journalism now.
Rivals? No! We can be partners, trading scoops and stuff!
Ooh. I like the sound of that.
What are your sources for some the stuff written in this thing?
Trade secret, can't say!

options.text: Now I'm wondering what's written in it...

reply.text: I'll put aside a copy just for you, Commander! Give it a read and lemme know what you think!

326.text: I watched a play. The script and performances were so excellent I remember every little detail of them.

comments.text: So 5/5 stars? Two thumbs up?
Yes. That's my glowing recommendation.
Hold up, when? A little bird told me no stage production is scheduled in the theater today.
That's not wrong. I've been replaying the whole play in my head here in the theater hall. If I focus, it's like I'm really attending a live performance.
I can picture the beautiful things I've seen if I close my eyes, so I think I know what you mean?

options.text: Let's go watch a new one sometime soon.

reply.text: Of course, Commander, if you'd like to!

327.text: A crispy shell complemented by a juicy filling that bursts in the mouth. Ah, what a culinary masterwork.

comments.text: I never knew your fondness of tempura extended quite THAT far...
It matters not how or what food is made of. If it pleases the palate, it is to be extolled.
That is certainly true!
In that case, I shall include it at tonight's banquet.
Why, thank you. I look forward to savoring it.
I can confidently say it will live up to your expectations.
It would seem... it's a favorite amongst destroyers as well...
You should taste it yourself, my sister. I'll dispatch a courier your way.
If you insist, then I shall...

options.text: I'm up for another tempura feast anytime.

reply.text: Delightful to hear it's to your tastes. Yes, I concur.

328.text: My present for the Commander iiis... daifuku filled with strawberries and love!

comments.text: I know I'd love em if I got em. Juicy red strawberries coupled with pearly white mochi are to die for~
Mhm! I hope the Commander will echo your sentiment!
Why is one of them half-eaten?
It's not half-eaten, just, you know, cut in half for the sake of a better picture!
Cut in half, you say? Then how'd that crumb get onto your cheek?
You've inspired me to try making some daifuku of my own.
Oh really? Give me a call when they're done, I want to see them for myself!
Okay! I can't promise they'll turn out any good though.

options.text: They taste superb. 10/10!

reply.text: Thank you! Be sure to finish them all and savor my love in its entirety~

329.text: I have confidential papers I must deliver to the Commander posthaste!

comments.text: Oh, you were in rush? That explains why you just ran past.
Forgive me! I was so focused on my mission I didn't think to stop and say hi.
It's probably not the smartest idea to tell the whole world you're carrying around secret documents...
They've already been delivered, so I believe it's no issue.
Already? Well then...
Look at that zoom blur! You must be going extremely fast!
Right you are. I will run with every cell in my body if so required of me!

options.text: THAT was quick. Appreciate it, Wakatsuki.

reply.text: It's my honor to be in your service!

330.text: Oh, will this weather ever abate...

comments.text: Rain sucks. It makes the air humid as heck and sends rabbits into hiding...
Bad weather puts me in a bad mood. When the clouds cry... it makes me sad...
I've got an idea. We'll make rain charms and send those storm clouds packing!
Do rain charms actually work...?
They do if you believe in 'em! Sit tight, I'll make a couple and we'll hang them up in your room later.
Alright... Thanks, Fubuki...

options.text: Don't worry. The sun will be back before you know it.

reply.text: You're right. It can't rain forever... Thanks for cheering me up, Commander...

331.text: just lowkey rescued a cat from a tree, ama

comments.text: How'd you find the cat? And how'd you even get up there?
i just heard meowing among the leaves while i was hanging around in the treetops lol
You know it's dangerous up there, right? You're lucky you didn't fall and break something.
true that... i'll try to stick to the ground as much as i can
I was going to call you out as well, but you DID save that poor cat, so I'll look the other way this once.
i know it's dangerous, ok? i won't be climbing up any more trees (unless i have to)
You're fine as long as you remember that. Also, what did you do with the cat afterwards?
it just ran off right after i let it go so idk. probably chasing rats by now

options.text: Thanks for patrolling the port at night. You're doing god's work.

reply.text: i was just chilling in a tree cause i felt restless but i'll take the compliment

332.text: A relaxing haven away from the summer's lingering rays, a perfect opportunity to clear one's mind.

comments.text: "A single moment of leisure, snatched from an eternity of labor." A literal breath of fresh air, so to speak~
It is always good to snatch some free time for yourself, but there's something else I'd like to get my hands on. Heehee~
Are we going swimming? Hang on, let me get my bikini!
No. Don't even think about ruining her peace and quiet.
It wouldn't bother me at all. She's than welcome to swim if she'd like. In fact, the more the merrier. Why not bring some friends while at it?
Heck yeah! I'll shoot a DM to Ping Hai and Ying Swei!
You know what'd make it even better? Chilling with some ice cream!
THIS! Let's go to the store and buy a whole box!
Escaping the heat with something sweet. That has a nice ring to it.

options.text: That's one of my favorite spots to catch a break from the sun.

reply.text: To paraphrase an old proverb: to a wise general, knowing when to rest is just as important as knowing when to strike.

333.text: Don't be shy, King Teddylot! Help yourself!

comments.text: maaan I could kill for some of that cake...
Nobody has to die today. I've set aside a slice just for thou!
wait really? aw yis! you da best knight ever!
But of course I am! Incidentally, thou art always welcome to my tea parties, my sister!
you bet I'm gonna take you up on that
Few things enrich a leisure day like tea and desserts. Wouldn't you agree?
Of course, Cardinal! Why wouldn't I agree? Your wisdom is unquestionable!
No need to get so worked up, my knight. You're free to disagree if you feel differently.
Certainly! I mean, I don't! I mean... okay!

options.text: For once, I wish I was a teddy bear...

reply.text: You needn't be King Teddylot to attend my tea party, Lord Commander! You may join if you so like!

334.text: A toast! To this magnificent day and to this awesome banquet!

comments.text: I look forward to our annual banquet more than anything else the whole year! Well, maybe except for Christmas.
Hah! Both are great times to get together and have a good time with friends and family.
Ooh, is that champagne?
No, this is Nevada. Heh. But yeah, you oughta try it once you're older!
Cmon let's skip the toasts and get straight to the drinking part!
I have a fun idea. Why don't we see who can hold their liquor best? I'll be waiting at the vacant table~
You're on, princess! Nobody drinks me under the table!

options.text: And I'll raise a toast to all of you wonderful people!

reply.text: I'll drink to that! Remember, we wouldn't be here today without you, Commander!

335.text: [The Annual Banquet] Lady Nagato has put on her party attire and will be joining the banquet shortly.

comments.text: Heheh! The photo came out pretty good, right, sis?
I've told you countless times, Mutsu... This account is ONLY for announcements! Use your own to comment on posts.
I know, I know, I just forgot to swap!
Lol it happened again? Never stop, Mutsu, because it's hilarious.
Wow. Now you truly look the part of a dignified flagship! ;)
Please, Great Veteran, don't mock me so...
Personally, I think it's a marvelous dress. It deserves praise.
I cannot tell if you're sincere or not...

options.text: It genuinely looks great on you.

reply.text: I'll choose to believe you're being sincere... Thank you for the compliment.

336.text: Feast your eyes upon my splendid new dress!

comments.text: "Splendid" really is the word! You're literally glimmering! *o*
Why, thank you! Filters and postprocessing are like magic sometimes~
Gosh. You're as bright as a whole constellation. I wish I could be like you...
You flatter me, Juneau! Also, you most definitely can be. You just have to be confident in yourself!
I suppose, though that's easier said than done for me...

options.text: Beautiful. Like the shimmering blue sea.

reply.text: Thank you, Commander! Might I mention you're quite good-looking yourself? Heheh~

337.text: I visited a garden and played with some super friendly swans today!

comments.text: Aww, they're so sweet! Doesn't being around animals just make you all warm inside? â™¡â™¡â™¡
Mhm! It feels strangely soothing feeding and petting them, too.
Can I come with you some other time? I wanna make friends with them too!
Absolutely! I'm sure they'd love to play with you.
Hey how come they're so calm around you but they run away when I get close???
Maybe because you run at them, shouting "hey white duckies, let's play"? I'd be startled too if I were a swan...
Be calm with them, and they'll be calm with you, I think...

options.text: I'm sure those swans loved your company.

reply.text: I loved their company too. It almost felt like they were nicer to me than I was to them.

338.text: I got the kitties all dressed up for Halloween!

comments.text: aww cute!! (â‰§â–½â‰¦)
Hopefully they'll make trick-or-treating feel less stressful for me...
I'm sure they will! good luck tonight janus (^.^)b
Just don't expect too much from them. Cats are whimsical creatures.
That's true... but these cats are well-behaved and wouldn't do that. Probably...
Nice cat ears~ My grand catification plan is progressing swimmingly >:3
I'm... not sure what you're talking about, but I'm happy to hear it I guess?

options.text: Ah, you've started a little witch a-cat-demia.

reply.text: Hehe, I guess you could say that. They'll make great purr-cerers one day.

339.text: Tonight I am not simply Albion, I am Albion the Devil Childe.

comments.text: Does that mean you're the Childe of a devil, or a devil who is a Childe?
Well, the two aren't mutually exclusive, are they? The latter might be a more apt description, however.
That is a good point. Perhaps next year I will dress up as your Elder devil counterpart.
Or we could be dark elves, or faeries. Whatever the case, I suppose you'll always be my Elder.
Bet you're gonna make a killing trick or treating in that spicy getup~
I hope so! It'll feel strange eliciting treats from my Elders, but that is in the spirit of the holiday, so... Trick or treat, Elder Abercrombie!
Aw shoot, I should've kept my gob shut!

options.text: How delightfully devilish.

reply.text: Thank you, Commander. I hope you'll be ready to give out treats, or be subject to a trick when I stop by.

340.text: umm. this is mingin so I clearly did something wrong.

comments.text: What were you making? Some sort of potion?
would you believe me if I said pumpkin risotto?
Pumpkin risotto sounds like a potion to me...
you know what, yeah. it's a potion.
What have I told you about leaving the cooking to the professionals?
I know I know but I won't improve if I don't practice, will I?
Forget it, I'll do it for you. Wait in the kitchen and don't touch anything else.
oh, cheers!

options.text: I'm impressed you managed to turn it green...

reply.text: green's healthy though, innit? I wouldn't touch it with a ten foot pole though.

341.text: Fire cannons! Jack-o'-lanturn them to scrap!

comments.text: Hah! I know I'd be scared if I saw a mighty big pumpkin flying right at me.
Right? That's what gave me the idea.
A direct hit from that would knock somebody's teeth out. I approve.
Don't be silly! If we can take cannon shells, we can handle a few pumpkins.
It'd be cooler if we could fire candy through the cannon instead...
Who says we can't? Manjuus, load the candy corn and chocolate!
Oh yeah! Sweet!

options.text: Are you thinking what I'm thinking, Oklahoma?

reply.text: A team battle with pumpkin cannons on both sides? That'd be the best Halloween activity ever!

comments.text: I love seeing you perform alchemy despite having no idea how any of it works!
how on earth did you turn those ingredients into something completely different...
That's what alchemy is all about! Isn't it amazing?
Being thrown into another world won't stop you from synthesizing, huh?
Nope! Wherever I end up, I'll always be an alchemist.
Is that... a witch's cauldron?
Close! It's an alchemy cauldron. You put things in it, mix 'em, and out comes something new.

options.text: Is it true you can make just about everything?

reply.text: With the right ingredients... probably?

343.text: I helped out at the store today.

comments.text: I appreciate it, nya! Having a smart, diligent assistant makes all the difference, nya.
I'm happy to help if it means learning new things from you and Shiranui.
Your expertise is evident. You give us both a run for our money.
Heheh. I AM the daughter of a merchant, so yeah.
Looks like you're adapting well to life in this place. You love to see it!
Yup. I'm glad you're doing the same, Ryza.

options.text: Thanks for helping around the port.

reply.text: Don't mention it. It's the least I could do.

344.text: With a new world comes new knowledge, and I have learned a lot of it.

comments.text: Any teacher would love to teach someone as committed to learning as you, Patricia. Keep it up.
You flatter me, Miss Pennsylvania. I am forever grateful for your guidance.
Studying's cool, but have you considered joining a club? The gardening and basketball clubs would welcome you ;D
Those do sound intriguing. I will give it some thought!
Hey, take your time. Just hit us up if you wanna give it a try.

options.text: Sounds like you're a model student.

reply.text: You should always strive to learn new things wherever you go.

345.text: So many new plants I've never seen before... This world is fascinating.

comments.text: It delights me to speak to someone who shares my passion for flowers.
And I'm glad to speak to someone who can share her extensive knowledge about them.
Think nothing of it. I'm happy to.
Oh, you dig plants too? I just got my hands on some new bonsai seedlings, you wanna plant some with me?
Seedlings? I'd like to have a look, at least.
Sure thing! :D

options.text: I hope you'll find the plant you're looking for.

reply.text: Thank you. It's heartening to know people are rooting for you.

346.text: Rigging training is indispensible, but so is daily muscle training.

comments.text: Feels good to work out, doesn't it?
Yeah. I'm also amazed how many exercise machines you have in this world.
The way you fight is profoundly impressive to me, Miss Lila! Could we spar together again later?
Sure. I'm always up for an opportunity to learn more from my fellow warriors.
You have the mindset of a truly formidable warrior. I respect that.
As do you, Enterprise. I believe we both have things to learn from each other.
Are you proposing a friendly exercise? I'm game as long as the Commander approves it.

options.text: You hold yourself to really high standards, don't you?

reply.text: As a warrior should. Training is the key to reaching new heights.

347.text: Activating combat command systems! Locking on to all targets!

comments.text: I don't know what all the meters and gauges are for, but I can tell you mean business.
Heh. Let's just say my power level is off the charts.
Dayum! What are you controlling there? A mech?
I wish! As baller as it looks, it's sadly just a movie prop.
Whoooa! This feels like something out of a superhero movie!
Haha, yeah! Is it a bird? Is it a plane? No, it's Superhornet!

options.text: I'll see if the R&D team can make something like this.

reply.text: You're gonna make a real one? Oh hell yeah.

348.text: Oh goodness, the world is spinning haha...

comments.text: Are you drunk again?
No not at all! See i cab drill type like normal
You're clearly drunk out of your mind. I'll send Vestal your way.
Come onnnn hornet, I'm not durnk!
Oh no... I told you to stay away from the wine, Yorktown!
I blame her type II rigging. It made her overestimate her own alcohol tolerance.
Why didn't anyone stop her?!
You couldn't even if you tried... But hey, no biggie. Vestal's looking after her.

options.text: Remember: everything in moderation.

reply.text: I only had a few glasses! It's no big deal

349.text: Choices, choices... Which should I wear today?

comments.text: Why not let the Commander decide? "Hey, which makes me look the cutest~?"
What?! No way in hell! I'd die from embarrassment if I asked that outright!
Outright~? So you ARE looking to dress to impress the Commander.
Am not! Although... I guess maybe that's a small, small part of it...
Yes, yeees... The cat ear crusade has reached the shores of the Eagle Union! >:3
I'm not part of any dumb crusade!
They all look good on you, Hammann.
Thank you! Although that makes it even harder to pick one...

options.text: You look cute in all of them ToT

reply.text: Flattery won't get you far with me, okay?! I'm so NOT over the moon!

350.text: Reading "Adventures in the Forest of Fables." It's harder to follow than I expected...

comments.text: Isn't that a children's book? How is it hard to follow?
The plot moves super fast and the pacing is all over the place. It's like the story changes from one chapter to the next.
Wait a second! Isn't that the name of the escape room scenario we ran not that long ago?
Oh, don't remind me. The cleanup afterwards was horrific...
They should've let me portray the Black Knight instead of Little Red Riding Hood!
So wait, doesn't that make this nonfiction?
I believe the phrase "based on a true story" is applicable here.

options.text: They made a book of it? Where are my royalties?

reply.text: Were you the "human lost in the forest"? That would explain a few things...

351.text: This will be on the exam, so make sure you review it closely!

comments.text: I can't be at the exam because a dog ate my homework~
That's unfortunate. I'll print out copies and bring them to your room.
Err, never mind, teach! The dog just coughed it up in one piece (real btw)!
I see you've installed a fancy new blackboard!
Indeed I have. I can even use my pointer with it.
Hooray for technology! This should make teaching more efficient.

options.text: We should install these all around the academy.

reply.text: Agreed. One of their main benefits is aiding distance learning for students who can't attend class.

352.text: Let's see if I can work out the most effective use of our Spring Festival budget...

comments.text: Geesh! You're counting faster than the camera can track!
Oh, you're right. I suppose it's because I'm used to this.
I might as well not even be here, considering how quickly you work... Sigh...
That's not true. I appreciate having you around.
Well... Thank you, I suppose.
Holy mackerel, nya! I could use someone with a knack for accounting like you at my store, nya.
I'd certainly be willing to do that. My only question is: what's the pay?

options.text: You don't have to minmax. We've got a sizable budget.

reply.text: I know it's sizable. That's why I want to work out a plan to maximize it!

353.text: One spring incantation, coming right up!

comments.text: Woah... Can you really do magic?
To a degree. What's most important is your wish to see it grow!
Whenever I plant a seed, I also make a wish for it to grow into a pretty, healthy flower.
And I'll bet it works. Flowers can sense feelings like that.
Can you wish instead of watering it too? ;D
Thoughts and feelings can't replace sustenance...

options.text: What other incantations do you know?

reply.text: Well, what kind are you interested in, our Singing Nightingale?

354.text: A fireplace warms the body. Huddling up warms the heart.

comments.text: Screw the cold! I'm spending the rest of winter in this cozy room.
Yes, it's cold, but you can't be a shut-in forever. Remember, you still have obligations!
I know, I know. I'll go outside later.
Winter is the season of fighting cold and loneliness together.
Mhm. But to fight the latter, you need the grace of a warm heart.
Couple shots of vodka should do the trick! Always warms my heart!

options.text: Staying home sounds nice, but so does a snowball fight.

reply.text: You can only do one or the other, Commander. Do you want to huddle up in my room, or go outside and play in the snow?

comments.text: Halloween was months ago! The Spring Festival isn't about ghosts!
I just thought it'd be fun to spice things up this year...
Oh man, I love being a ghost! You should've seen the look on An Shan's face LMAO
Err... These comments are public, remember?
I TOLD you to stop scaring people, Fu Shun! Do I have to ground you again?
Okay, okay, I'll stop!

options.text: I approve of this collision of cultures.

reply.text: Why don't you join in yourself, Commander? I think you'd rock as a jiangshi.

356.text: There is beauty to be found even in the biting cold of winter.

comments.text: The night whisks in the spring breeze; the next morn, a thousand petals adorn the trees. That is the poem you are referring to, yes?
Indeed. We are blessed to get to admire such beautiful sights in this cold weather.
I dunno about you, but when I see a tree covered in snow, I just wanna shake it!
Especially if someone's sitting under it, right?
Ehh... Then I'll pass. Last time I did that, that someone was An Shan...
RIP.
The icicles and soft snow both look kinda yummy... I wonder how they taste.
don't even think about it! you'll get sick!

options.text: It sure is beautiful. Here's to another good year.

reply.text: I'm certain it will be, as long as you're with us.

357.text: Let me sing for you the story of our Champion.

comments.text: Let us hear it. What adventures does this champion embark on?
It begins with the Champion's departure for battle, and ends in a triumphant return.
The masses may love embellished tales, but I'd prefer hearing about this champion's more pedestrian anecdotes.
I have no idea what she just said, but I wanna hear something spicy!
I'd need the Champion's permission to divulge such things.
I'm clearly missing something here. Who the hell is "our champion"?

options.text: Who comes up with all these tales, anyway?

reply.text: Comes up with? Why, they are based on the true story of our Champion!

358.text: Rejoice, Commander, for I have finished cleaning.

comments.text: As in, disposed of a threat? I don't believe there are any enemies in the vicinity of the port.
Many spots around the office were long overdue a thorough tidying, so I took it upon myself.
What you MEAN by "tidying" and "cleaning"?! Please tell me you didn't do anything drastic!
What is there to clarify? I used a set of tools to take care of some filth.
So YOU'RE behind that loud boom that came from the office?
Yes. Rest assured, I've already dealt with the resulting dust and debris.
Well, splendid job, but that's not the issue here!

options.text: That's... one way to do spring cleaning.

reply.text: You're welcome, Commander.

359.text: It's all or nothing when it comes to shopping! I'll take your whole stock!

comments.text: My angel has descended from heaven to secure my financial future forever, nya! Thank you, nya!
Hah! You're welcome, li'l merchant. But I expect a discount next time.
Goodness me, that's a lot of money.
What can I say? LNY is a big holiday, and I'm a big spender.
sure that stuff is necessary, but you don't NEED to go all out, do you?
There's a time to exercise moderation, and LNY ain't it! Besides, no problem with splurging if nothing goes to waste, right?
you're not wrong, but at the same time...

options.text: Attagirl! Go big or go home!

reply.text: Damn right! Money's meant to be spent â€“ the more, the better!

360.text: Guess who just pulled an accidental all-nighter.

comments.text: hum-hum. were you working on something, by any chance?
Yup. I started working on a brilliant idea I had and the next thing I know, it's morning.
Been there, done that. It's easy to lose track of time when inspiration strikes!
Have a shot of vodka. It'll kick you right back into gear!
Good idea. I'll do just that.
Vodka's the last thing you need after an all-nighter! If you insist on drinking, make it warm beer instead.
Please try not to make a habit of staying up late. Have you eaten? I have freshly made borscht, if you'd like.
Sounds lovely. I'll be there in a few.

options.text: Maybe you should take the day off.

reply.text: I'll be fine. That vodka did the drink and I'm back on all pistons now.

361.text: Ahahaha! Worthless plants! I'll cut you all down!

comments.text: Ah, isn't that the spot they were going to put a new flowerbed?
Wait... You're saying I did someone a FAVOR by doing that?
Are you the Iron Blood Scissorhands I've heard about, Rupprecht? Just curious.
Who? I don't know anything about a "scissorhands"!
Feels good, doesn't it? Cutting down everything that stands in your path. It's even more fun when you intentionally leave survivors.
Yeah! Wait, what do you mean "survivors"?

options.text: Why'd you go grass-cutting out of the blue?

reply.text: Because I felt like it! Got a problem with that?

options.text: You showed that lawn who's boss.

reply.text: Exactly, and I expect a reward for my hard work! Maybe then I'll do something even more impressive next time!

362.text: I have some special black tea just for you, Commander. I'm sure you'll love it~

comments.text: You always go above and beyond with your preparation of tea... in both taste and preparation.
I simply strive to seek stimulation from the insipid and mundane parts of daily life~
Lady Implacable... I believe the tea is best left to the professionals...
Why's that? I think I've certainly outdone myself this time!
Hmm? Is that the newest type of instant tea powder?
Uhh... Well, it's supposed to be very healthy for you.

options.text: Err, sure, I'll give it a try.

reply.text: I knew your thirst would win out, Commander~

363.text: Sorting and organising Master's everyday belongings is an essential part of being an excellent maid.

comments.text: Well done, Scylla. You even make sure to keep us stocked up on sterile earpicks~
I am hardly worthy of the praise. It is simply my job, 'tis all.
With Scylla by your side, you won't have to worry about anything getting lost ever again
It is not some magical power inherent to my being. Proper sorting and organisation is all you need to not lose things.
Huh? So that's where my crown walked off to. Shoot, I already bought a new one...
You're lucky I found it, but make sure to take better care of your belongings next time, Miss Valiant.

options.text: Thanks for always keeping things tidy!

reply.text: I simply do what is expected of me. Are there any other facets of your life you'd like me to manage for you, Master?

364.text: Phew... Barely made it back before curfew...

comments.text: What curfew...?
Umm, it's just something I hold myself to. "Return to your nest before the ordained time," or something like that?
...Speaking of bird analogies, you look like a chicken that's been dropped in a pot and stewed for a few hours.
You're back later than usual today. Did something happen?
I saw the most beautiful night sky while taking my stroll, and ended up losing track of the time.

options.text: What happens if you miss your curfew?

reply.text: Then, umm, when I get out of bed the next morning...

365.text: Why is my luck always so rotten...

comments.text: Are you alright?! Do you need me to take you to the hospital?
I'm fine now, Vestal and Jervis were kind enough to take a look at me...
Ohmygosh, I am SO sorry! That was the one I belted outta the ballpark...
It's my fault for letting you get a hit in the first place. Sorry again!
It's okay... Stuff like this happens all the time, so I'm used to it... Ahaha...
Would you like to come visit us at the shrine in the mountains? It's a great way to purify bad luck!
Really? Maybe I'll give it a try then...

options.text: Are you sure you're fine? Do you want me to head over there?

reply.text: Oh... Thanks, but I'd feel bad for using up your precious time ><

366.text: Ooooh, look at this cache I found in the Commander's room! Wonder what's inside~

comments.text: Hey, hands off the Commander's stuff!
Puh-lease. It's not like I took it with me or opened it. What's wrong with taking a look? Plus, aren't you curious about what scandalous stuff is inside~?
N-not at all!
Did you open it or not? I wanna know if the Commander's got pervy mags in there.
Huuh? I didn't put any points in my lockpicking skill~

options.text: Where the heck did you get that...

reply.text: You can't be a Hero without having a keen sense for treasure~

367.text: Seize the day. Make snowmen before the snow melts.

comments.text: I love snowmen! And snowcats too. That's what you're making, right?
Mhm, I worked pretty hard on it. Looks nice, doesn't it?
Oh, definitely! I thought you missed my reply for a minute there.
We should have a snowball fight too, before spring sets in.
Sign me up!
Just don't use my snowman for target practice, thanks...
It's getting warmer. Your little guy won't last for long.
I know. Watching snow melt little by little is enjoyable, though.

options.text: Cute!

reply.text: Thanks. You could make a lovely snowman too if you put effort into it, Commander. Give it a try sometime.

368.text: Hmm. This works decently as camouflage.

comments.text: Disguising as a roadside mascot to spy on people... Not a bad idea.
She looks so warm and fluffy. Makes me wanna run up and hug her!
Yeah... Those aren't exactly the reactions I was going for...
What are you doing dressed as a snowman?
Blending in. Two snowmen side by side ought to look perfectly normal.
Kinda cute. Isn't it cold in there, though?
Maybe if you're not me. I'm built different.
How nice of you to keep my snowman company. Now you're snowbuddies.
Oh, so you built it. Good to know.

options.text: All I see are two snowmen...

reply.text: Good. My prey won't know I'm here until it's too late.

369.text: Spring is here, comrades! Let's celebrate with lots and lots of vodka!

comments.text: Couldn't have said it better myself! Today we're gonna chug 'til we hit the floor!
Is that a challenge? I'm gonna outdrink you this time!
Them's fighting words. May the best drinker win!
Seems the more people drink, the louder they get...
Her poor liver... You think she's okay?
I saw her stumbling a lot, but she'll be fine. By now, she's probably preparing for her next battle.
My poor snowman...
The question is, was it spring that melted it, or was it Sevastopol's warm spirit?

options.text: You sure you haven't had too much?

reply.text: Too much? I'm not a baby, Comrade Commander! I can hold my liquor juuuuust fine!

370.text: Spare time is best spent with classical music playing in the background.

comments.text: Do you want a new record, Lord Bismarck? I can find one for you!
Why, thank you. That would be great.
Don't mention it! I'm always happy to serve!
If you like classical music, you'll love a live orchestra performance.
I'm sure I would. The only issue is making time for it in my busy schedule.
Always a treat to see you in a good mood.
Same to you, my sister. I heard you've come out of your shell and made new friends.
Yes, it's true. Living in such a friendly environment makes it easy, I suppose.

options.text: Man, now I want a gramophone in my office.

reply.text: You won't regret getting one. I can recommend you some records, if you're interested.

comments.text: you're gonna have to break that bad boy open one day tho
Says who? Once it's full, I'm perfectly content to leave it that way.
You must slay the dragon to receive its treasure, huh? Got it~
Is that a threat? Think about your next words very carefully.
Please, I'm too low level right now! But once I get a ring of invisibility, that dragon's history~
Hmph! I'd like to see you try, you hobbit!
So where does the money for this nest egg of yours come from?
My Regina finds coins here and there around the port. It's not theft if nobody misses it.

options.text: It's not much, but it adds up in the end.

reply.text: Exactly. Set aside a coin here and there, and soon you'll find yourself atop a pile of gold.

372.text: Slow Juustagram day, hmm? Don't mind if I make a post myself!

comments.text: I swear, it's like you never take your eyes off this app...
You need to keep up with the latest trends to stay on top. Don't you want to know what the Commander is up to?
You're right, I do! I need to check Juustagram more often...
You check it manually? Get with the times and enable push notifications, dummy~
I hate how you're always one step ahead of me...
Did you hear? The ice cream store is bringing back its once-a-season flavor this afternoon only.
I've already reserved a pint! I'm just waiting for time to pass~

options.text: See anything cool or funny lately?

reply.text: Not particularly... Buuut you could totally post a selfie, Commander. You'd be the talk of the town in 5 minutes flat!

374.text: You call this training? Pfft I could do it in my sleep

comments.text: damn, you were keeping pace with me out there. mad props to you!
Hey, right back at you. You live up to your name of number 1
The course is too dang zigzaggy... Can't we just make it a straight line
It wouldn't be much of a challenge if you could just sail forwards.
I know! Why not add some fun interactive elements?
Ooh, you just gave me inspiration! You know what'd be great? Springboards that send you into the sky!
The training area is for training, not for circus acts, people.

options.text: All in all, great performance from everyone!

reply.text: But mine was the best, right? Come on, you can say it.

comments.text: cute. you two are like an alligator and a plover
Umm, what does that mean...?
uh it means you're good friends basically. look it up
Nice! You gonna be playing at the banquet? :D
Yup! I hope everyone will like it.
Diligent as ever, I see. Will you be performing for the Commander?
Umm... that's a secret for now!

options.text: Can't wait to see the fruits of your practice.

reply.text: Thank you... We'll both give it our all!

comments.text: Looking gorgeous! I bet we'd make an awesome duo on stage :3
sure! what do we call ourselves?
How about "Cat & Rabbit"? Cause you bring the bunny energy and I bring the cat energy ^w^
it's got a nice ring to it! we're SO doing a duet next time I'm on stage
Quite the impressive performance. For a klutz, anyway.
this was just something I thought I'd try during the rehearsal. the real show will be even better!
If you're that passionate during rehearsals, the real deal might be worth watching.

options.text: Attagirl! I love your style.

reply.text: aww, thanks! you have a great eye for talent, Commander!

377.text: A sleeping Laffey has been spotted in the wild.

comments.text: Not on the sofa again! I've told her a million times she'll get a cold if she does that!
Well you know her... she falls asleep whenever, wherever â”(Â°ãƒ®Â°)â”Œ
How is that picture-worthy...
Because it's cute and funny in a way. Did you have a good rest, sleepyhead?
Yeah... Morning...
That has to be the biggest carrot I've ever seen!
It's snug and cozy... Feels like hugging the Commander...
Wait, does it?
Wait what?! I've gotta get one for myself!!

options.text: Why is that hat on the cushion?

reply.text: So I can pretend it's you, I guess?

comments.text: I've been thinking, haven't you been stuffing yourself quite a bit lately?
What can I say? People have been making irresistibly good food.
I'm pleased to hear you adore my macarons!
Yes, they're delectable. The kind of cooking that makes someone fall for you.
Well... the way to a person's heart is through their stomach, after all.
My lord, how I wisheth that were I...
You want macarons? I can toss you a few when I make my next batch.
Hell yes!

options.text: Those must be some top-notch macarons.

reply.text: That they are. I've never had better.

379.text: I'm working on a song for the Commander.

comments.text: What's with the handcuffs?
Might serve as a weight so she can train her arm muscles while she plays.
There are better ways to work out than that...
I just thought they might come in handy at some point. Don't overthink it.
Restraining a person using music... Very creative. I like it.
It takes more than music to restrain someone, you know.

options.text: I'm in danger, aren't I...

reply.text: Only in danger of having a good time. You'll love it.

380.text: Where's my letter? WHERE HAS IT GONE?!

comments.text: Which letter? Surely your declaration of love hasn't gone missing?
Oh dear. Imagine if someone found it and used it to nefarious ends.
Stop imagining doomsday scenarios and help me find it!
Looking for something? My SG radar might be able to help.
Yes please! If you find it return it to me ASAP!!
Snailmail in this day and age? A DM is 5 times quicker and easier.
But a letter is 500 times more romantic!

options.text: Want me to look around for you?

reply.text: Thanks but there's no need to go out of your way for such a small thing!

381.text: captain black bunny and vice captain white bunny are the bestest of friends ^.^

comments.text: Aw they're so happy together!
yup! they've got a whole company of friends too, including captain kitty and the dolphin knights c:
I wanna meet them, can we have a big get together?
sure! i'll be your little interpreter for the occasion ^.-
Captain Black Bunny is tough competition, but I won't be outdone so easily!
truuue. black bunny is a hell of a captain, but nobody out-captains the great pompeo magno!
Is that a puppet show? Your little bunnies are sooo adorable~
aww thanks <3

options.text: Enter: the Commander, a.k.a. the Evil Baron!

reply.text: oh noes! the big baddy is here! protect me captain black bunny!

options.text: The Commander, your loyal knight, hath arrived!

reply.text: my trusty knight, so right and fair! you're a role model to my bunbuns ^.^

382.text: It's that time of the day again! Hot milk for everyone!

comments.text: no better drink for dunking your cookies in!!
Have as much as you like~
I just love milk! I drink it all the time.
Same here. A glass of milk a day keeps your bones healthy and strong.
My, you're a great motherly figure for the little ones~
Hot milk and cookies are a great combination, but have you ever had it with strawberry shortcake?
I haven't, actually. I'll remember to try it someday!

options.text: Got milk (for me)?

reply.text: Of course! I'll bring some to your office right away.

390.text: Another day of balancing body and spirit.

comments.text: never committing to one thing. like always.
Maybe I'll commit to not helping you the next time Meowfficers surround you, hmm?
yeah, yeah, real clever...
I could use your help with "balancing" the amount of tasks on my plate right now...
Oh, but I work behind the scenes. On-stage work is your field of expertise.
It can be very hard to have to choose between two options...
Be that as it may, nobody likes a fence-sitter.
That is true...

options.text: Your work-life balance is another tough thing to manage.

reply.text: All you need is the right method. Maybe you'd like some advice on the matter, Commander?

391.text: Hmm... Which one should I choose today...

comments.text: Aha! I see a lost little lamb! Would you like a witch's opinion?
Um, sure, if it's not too much to ask?
Allow me to help by absolving you of all your worries.
While I'm curious about what you mean by "absolve," I think I'll gracefully pass on the offer...
Have you tried the Sacrament of Prayer?
Is that some kind of... fortune-telling?

options.text: I'm sure you'll find your luck one way or another.

reply.text: Thank you for your kind words, Commander.

392.text: My crystal ball will reveal the secrets of your fate.

comments.text: I feel much better now after receiving your wisdom, Miss Witch...
You're welcome. May luck find its way to you!
schweet. do you do love predictions too?
Of course. Remember to book in advance.
Heheh! Sign me up for a sesh too!
My, I predict there's going to be a real queue.

options.text: I'd like to book an appointment.

reply.text: Sure thing. What kind? Perhaps you want me to divine your prospects of... love?

393.text: Check out the chonker I caught!

comments.text: With a spear, no less. I applaud your skill.
Heheh. All you've gotta do is get the timing right. It's easy-peasy!
Whoa! That's one use I'd never have thought of!
There's plenty of other uses for spears. Just gotta get creative!
Like what? Tell me, tell me!
Sure! I shall pass my wisdom onto you later today, young padawan~
There are better ways to fish... Still, nice catch.
Thanks! You gotta make something tasty out of this bad boy once I bring 'im home!
Huh? Why should I do it?

options.text: Pan or stir fry?

reply.text: Doesn't matter to me as long as it tastes good!

394.text: Maybe we need to add more ingredients to the mix?

comments.text: The problem may be the order you added them.
Possible. Someone should taste test it to confirm.
What is THAT? A magical potion that boosts all your stats, perchance?
Are you joking? That's obviously a poison potion that'll drain all your HP if you drink it
What are you making? Some sort of magic concoction?
Not quite... Just a drink to soothe the nerves and reinvigorate your spirits.
Who knows? Maybe it has other, unknown effects as well?

options.text: That's a... vivid green color it has.

reply.text: It certainly is. Could I interest you in testing it for us?

395.text: My ears are always open for all.

comments.text: Can I confess remotely? I've mostly worked from home lately.
Well... Confessing on Juustagram may not be the wisest, as these posts are public...
Yeah, true. Someone should make an online confessional or something!
Would you even use it? I don't remember you being the confessing type.
Guess you're right, lol.
You have my sincerest thanks for always listening to the people's woes and confessions. You are a saint.
Please, you humble me! I'm simply happy to be trusted with everyone's confessions!

options.text: Can I confess something?

reply.text: Of course, Commander! I would love nothing more than to guide you when you feel lost!

396.text: Note to self: use more seasoning next time...

comments.text: That looks right tasty!
Thank you, though I'm afraid it doesn't actually taste like much.
I can help with that! I may not be the best cook, but I DO know how to season!
Ahem. Manchester, Her Majesty requests your presence.
Your food is amazing, nya~ BUT! It could be even better with one of my new Dragon Empery cooking sets, nya. Interested, nya?
Could it really make me a better cook?
Hey! Don't push your weird products on her!
I have to disagree; your food is lovely. You just need more confidence in yourself.
Do you really think so? Thank you.

options.text: Looks good, actually. I want a taste.

reply.text: Of course, Commander. I shall bring a plate to your office right at once.

options.text: Don't change anything. Stay true to yourself.

reply.text: If you say so, Commander. Incidentally, would you like a taste?

397.text: calling it now: these things are gonna fly off the shelves!

comments.text: Ah, a Sakuran who gets it! No other weapon can match the balance of portability and versatility of a rifle.
fr fr! guns are sick as hell
Bullcrap! The katana is the king of weapons!
^^^ What she said!
Well, I think a good javelin is da bes _(:3ã€âˆ )_
I'm inclined to agree.
hey each weapon's got its pros and cons. a rifle's just the best overall!
Do handheld weapons even matter? We all use cannons the most at the end of the day lol
Uh...
I mean...
that's totes besides the point!

options.text: Just be careful how you handle it.

reply.text: don't you worry! if I stock it, it's got the owari seal of safety!

398.text: Heheh... Who will be my next victim~?

comments.text: You went TOO far with that one Hatsuzuki ;-;
Did I? Oopsie!
Promise you won't do that ever again?
I'll try. But if the demon of intrusive thoughts whispers in my ear, well...
Wow! You don't feel sorry in the slightest, do you?!
My, what a cute ghost you are.
Aww, thanks! You're not scared of ghosts?
Not at all. If a ghost bothered me, I would simply exorcise it. Would you like a demonstration?
Eep! No thanks, I'll pass!
I dig your ingenuity~ You should totally also hide behind a bush and jump out at passersby. Scares the living daylight out of 'emâ™ª
Ooh, good idea. Any advice on who I should target in particular?
No one and everyone! Just come with me to the haunted house tomorrow and we'll find some peeps~
Oh. I, uh, have plans for tomorrow...

options.text: You should do the test of courage too.

reply.text: I think I'll pass on that one, honestly... Unless you mean as one of the staff!

399.text: Yes! Gaze upon my magnificent castle!

comments.text: Magnificence levels far exceeding the average detected.
But of course! Expect no less of a dragon such as I!
Gascogne requests knowledge pertaining to "playing at the beach." Knowledge is required to better carry out Master's orders during next beach visit.
Come again? Is playing in the sand truly a subject one needs to study?
Skills like this could win you the sandcastle building contest... Clearly, I'll need to up my game!
You do that! Chasing the tail of a dragon is an honorable endeavor.

options.text: Good lord... How did you make that?

reply.text: If you're truly curious then perhaps I shall divulge my secrets in person.

options.text: I don't say this often, but holy hell and wow.

reply.text: I take it as a point of pride that even you are in awe!

400.text: This thing is broken! BROKEN, I say!

comments.text: I assure you my machines never break, nya.
Nonsense! My fists are far stronger than this! This cannot possibly be right!
If it's strength you want, you can borrow my Buff Buffer Punching Glove. That'll give you the results you want!
Resort to cheap tricks, you say? I would never!
There is not a soul who doubts your strength, Asanagi. We all have days such as this.
Yes, of course... I was just holding back without realizing it!

options.text: It's alright. Your fists are still the strongest on earth.

reply.text: So you learned since your last gut punch. Good.

options.text: Isn't 5 the max score? What you got is still impressive.

reply.text: That explains it! No wonder!

401.text: Why are the notes so dull? Is something wrong with my instrument?

comments.text: I think the answer is right under your nose.
Is it? I practice and practice, and it still sounds wrong... Maybe I need to replace the strings?
Hey now, nya! That instrument I sold you is perfectly fine, nya!
Have you tried, uh, straightening your back?
How would that help?
On second thought... Yeah, that's not gonna be nearly enough.
Sigh... I just want to play music...
I think it's safe to say something's holding the strings down.
Something? What do you mean? Like, a ghost?
A GHOST?! WHERE?! DON'T LET IT NEAR ME!

options.text: Keep trying things. You'll get it right eventually.

reply.text: I will! Maybe the problem is just with me, and practice will solve it!

402.text: My katana stays with me tonight! I'm not letting go of it!

comments.text: I don't think people are fine with you bringing a sword to the banquet.
But my katana is my soul! I'm a hollow being without it!
why not just leave it on a display rack or something
Never! I will not relinquish my katana!
considering how your personality does a 180 without it, i guess that's fair lol
But what if your katana yearns for freedom? What if it WANTS to be let go? /joking
That's NOT funny, dammit!

options.text: One doesn't simply let go of a dear partner.

reply.text: At least YOU understand my conundrum, Commander!

403.text: Your dream shall now become true...

comments.text: daaamn shinano that fit is lit! you're rockin it like a queen! i also got a new swimsuit just the other day and i can't wait to show it off
The fashion biz isn't as straightforward as I thought, nya.
i don't know much about fashion lol but like, pretty sure you're gucci if you stock what the commander likes
It's that simple, nya?!
It looks gorgeous on you.
Truly? This one is surprised even a garment like this can suit me...
It's true. You look beautiful.

options.text: That's it! That's the swimsuit from my dream!

reply.text: It's what your heart desired, and so I decided to give you it...

options.text: I can't believe this... Am I still dreaming?

reply.text: You are not... What you see is waking reality...

404.text: Allow me to play you a song to mark the occasion.

comments.text: Damn, you were wild with that sax! I wanna learn to play like that. Got any tips?
I'd be honoured to teach a lady such as yourself. Come to the salon in the Royal Navy's dormitory when you find the time.
Signora, you are like a shining jewel upon the stage.
Why, thank you for the compliment. Your dress, similarly, is like a glimmering, gorgeous rose.
Ah, the opening shots of a lovely flattery war.

options.text: You're actually glowing! Literally!

reply.text: That's just the lighting, Commander. Don't be silly.

options.text: That was a perfect performance. Bravo, Wales.

reply.text: Thank you. I'm honoured that you liked it.

405.text: Sorry for dozing off! I laid down to rest my eyes for a moment, and... I didn't mean to fall asleep! Really!

comments.text: It seems someone needs to take another crash course on proper party behaviour.
Please, not that again...
Procrastinating is an art. You should learn from the pros like me and Le Malin. Tell her.
If you want to nap without being caught you need a quiet place where people won't look. Like a lounge for example
I... see? I suppose I'll take that lesson to heart.
You should attend a Sardegnian banquet sometime. You can rest on a couch and even eat lying down if you'd like.
Eating while lying down? But that's bad manners...
Nobody minds. Our traditional banquets can go on for days, so in the end everyone ends up lying down to eat or chat with other guests.
Then I'd love to, when I get the chance. But if they last for days, I'd have to break my curfew...

options.text: When you need to rest, just rest. It's okay.

reply.text: It is? Really?

comments.text: I heard someone say the Commander's toes might need a look at...
God I feel like rubbish... orz
Hey, don't feel too bad! You just need a lot of good, hard practice and you'll get better at it!
You should get some cake. It'll cheer you up.
I'd kill for some cake... only problem is all the bakeries are closed this late...
I'll bring a few slices and we can eat them together.
You'll do that for me? Thank you!!

options.text: It's fine. You'll get the hang of it eventually.

reply.text: I'm SO sorry Commander ( ;âˆ€;)

407.text: One, two, three. Repeat... One, two, three...

comments.text: You've been at this for a while now...
Mhm. I need to perfect my dance moves so I don't embarrass myself in front of the Commander!
Keep it up... I'm rooting for you.
Heck yeah! Become the dancing queen!
That's hard when you're dancing alone. Do you think you could rehearse with me, Javelin?
You mean... play the Commander's part? You sure? I might step on your toes...
A misstep here or there is no big deal. I'll take any help I can get!
Let's not forget to take regular breaks, now. You'll wear yourself out if you continue nonstop.
But that's wasting valuable time...
To dance your best, your body and mind must be relaxed. A balance between rehearsal and resting will yield the best results, I assure you.
I see! Thank you. I'll be sure to do some yoga in between sessions.
That is not exactly what I had in mind...

options.text: Keep it up!

reply.text: Of course! I promise you won't be disappointed.

408.text: Stay calm, me... You've got this. It's easy.

comments.text: Splendid performance. That must've taken a lot of courage on your part.
Oh, please! It was a cakewalk!
You're so cool! I'd probably get stage fright and wouldn't be able to play anything.
Heh, it's not as bad as it looks. You could do it too if you practiced!

options.text: My hat's off to you. That was beautiful.

reply.text: Heheh, thanks. I gave it my all.

options.text: It must've been exhausting. Take some time to rest.

reply.text: Oh, don't worry about me, Commander. I know when it's time to rest.

409.text: That's the team flag, not a damn cat teaser! Ugh... What do I do with this little guy?

comments.text: A cat snuck into your lounge? That's a rare sight.
Right. It'll probably just run away if I try to get close, though.
I take it you're not used to being around animals?
Nah. I guess it's having fun, but I just want it to leave the flag alone.
Need a hand? I'm good at dealing with, or should I say, handling kittens.
That'd be great. Thanks.

options.text: We can't let it get scratched up.

reply.text: Obviously not. I'm doing everything I can.

options.text: Aww. It just wants to be friends.

reply.text: I guess I'm happy about that. The flag, though...

410.text: Awesome race, everyone! I can't wait for the next one!

comments.text: That was a solid performance. You must take damn good care of your bike.
Thanks! Treat your partner well, and it'll treat you well in return.
Obviously. Why won't you drop by Iron Blood's garage sometime? We oughta share knowledge.
Oh, I'd love to. I've been quite curious about your maintenance equipment for some time!
Racing ain't bad, but going on a journey and feeling the wind in your hair really takes the cake.
Good idea. I might just do that myself after the tourney.
Think about it. Going nowhere in particular, leaving your lame worries behind... Just don't forget the way home.
You did good. Keep it up for the next race.
Oh, of course, Enterprise! I'm going for gold!

options.text: You could be a professional racer with those skills.

reply.text: Please, you flatter me. I see it just as a hobby.

options.text: Wow, look how shiny it is!

reply.text: Right? I waxed it really thoroughly.

411.text: The holy light shall never fade.

comments.text: oh god so bright... someone please get me sunglasses or i'll go blind...
I... pray for your safety.
May those wings bathed in light take you much higher.
Let us all pray for victory to always grace the port.
Thank you for the prayers. May the golden light forever bless you.
Can I get some prayers for this next gacha roll~?
SR for me too!
SR for me too!
Very well... May luck favor you all!

options.text: How'd the rehearsal go? You feeling good?

reply.text: I feel excellent. Our group rehearsals are quite enjoyable.

options.text: I can hardly wait for the show.

reply.text: Thank you. I will give you a ticket later.

412.text: Ah, the port at night! It glitters like my big ol' pile of treasure.

comments.text: Hey, are your tentacles available? This genius mechanic could use the help of a few extra appendages!
What's in it for me? If you're paying, I'm game.
I bet you could snap some good Pulitzer bait if you gave 'em a camera!
Perfect mood for a plate of schweinshaxe and a glass of Iron Blood beer.
Personally, I would haveth a glass of wine.
I'll pass on the alcoholic stuff, thanks. Even a whiff of it makes my head spin.
Are you going to bed already? I saw the lights go out in your room just a minute ago.
One of my pirate rules is to always turn the lights off on time. Gotta set an example for other Tempestas.

options.text: Ooh, what a great view.

reply.text: Sure is. You should come and see it with me sometime!

options.text: What drinks DO you like? For future reference.

reply.text: All of them! Just not alcoholic stuff. Besides those, I'm always eager to try new things.

413.text: It's okay to trick me even if I treat you!

comments.text: Thanks for all the candy though it's scary how you make them float
It's a ghost doing it! Ruuun!
Come on, don't be scared. I'll give some more!
Hehe you've got some sweet tricks, lady!
That's a clever use of your power of invisibility.
Yeah. I'd say it's pretty spooky...
Heh. Maybe I should go trick or treating too and make more use of it.
What a good girl Argo is. Just like my Self.
Candy for everyone! For Argo, for you, and for your... "self" I guess?
Argo must be working hard to look after her...
As long as she's having fun, right? Heh.

options.text: Wait... so it's been Argo handing out the candy, not you?

reply.text: Yup. She loves causing a li'l stir now and then.

options.text: That's an eccentric way to give out candy.

reply.text: Eccentric means novel, and novel means surprising. Perfect for Halloween, right?

414.text: The ethereal beauty makes her night cruise~

comments.text: Yes, quite otherworldly indeed. I would not be surprised to see some spectral attendants following you as well.
Spirits? Ghosts? Where?
Unfortunately, not for mortal eyes to see. Heehee~
always feels nice taking a stroll through the evening breezeâ€“ wait, where the heck are you?
As clear waters flow upon pristine sand; ghostly lights dot the night like pine flowers.
looking for beautiful sceneries, are ya? well, I know just the place for you! lemme give you my recommendation!
By all means, please do!
hey, bring me with you too!

options.text: How beautiful friendship is; 'tis more enviable than immortality.

reply.text: Heehee. Well said, Commander~â™ª

comments.text: Oof. I feel for you. Not being able to drink oxy-cola sucks ass.
It's right there... just out of reach...
Need someone to pick it up for you, eh? I'll be right over!
Oi! You don't need a camera to help someone get a bottle, Ark Royal!
Whatcha doing indoors by yourself? It's Halloween! You should be outside!
What are your plans, 556? You going trick or treating?
Going outside is a pain... I'll let the little guys handle the candy.

options.text: It's right there. Can't you just get up and get it?

reply.text: But that's a pain... Even changing my pose takes a lot of effort.

options.text: You poor thing. I'll get you another cola.

reply.text: Bring some crisps while you're at it...

comments.text: You were serious about getting into the Commander's office without the key?
Yes! And I did knock before entering~
Egads! I am sleeping with one eye on my door henceforth!
You're next, little one~
Now I'm in the mood for a horror movie!
Like one with lots of Foo's friends? I wanna watch that too.
What an interesting way of doing it... I think I will give it a try as well~
Oh boy... I'll have to up security around the office.

options.text: Welp... We'll need to replace the office door.

reply.text: Don't worry, I only broke a prop~ But, I'll do it on the real deal if you ask me to~

options.text: The Halloween spirit is in full swing! You love to see it.

reply.text: Right? I'm glad you agree~

417.text: No no no! It's gonna fall over!

comments.text: I'm no professional, but that looks like expensive equipment to me.
It is, and this happened because I got TOO into character...
So what happened? Did the lamp break?
Luckily, I caught it at the last second. This blooper could've gone much worse.
Nice cosplay! I wanna do that too!
Just need to dress the filming set like the Warring States era.
The outfit and the makeup look perfect! Incidentally, would you mind asking when the set is vacant next?
Sure. I'll ask the director.

options.text: That's the kind of authentic expression you only get in real situations.

reply.text: Heh. I'll show you the film reel once it's developed.

options.text: Do you need someone to man the camera?

reply.text: Sure, if you want to help. Come to the set. Oh, and try not to wet yourself from fright!

418.text: Tadah! I got a new ninja gadget!

comments.text: Excellent choice, Asuka! This is how dangerous a shinobi should look! I will follow your example!
If you're gonna start following examples, how about you start with turning off the lights before bed?
Wait, does she know some trick to staying hidden without hiding in the dark? Tell me all about it!
Whacking people with a torp sounds like a bad idea. If it blows up, everyone's gonna hear it.
Sometimes leaving no witnesses is a valid stealth approach. It doesn't matter how loud you are!
I feel like there's a kernel of truth in that...
Are you seriously using torps as melee weapons?
Well, yeah! Only downside is I can't hide them like kunais. They're too big to even fit under my uniform.

options.text: Please use something less likely to explode.

reply.text: It'll be fine! I'll be careful!

options.text: Where would you hide them? Between your...?

reply.text: Breasts? Yeah, that's normal among shinobis.

419.text: How do you bond with these creatures?

comments.text: Have you tried feeding them? They'll run right up to you if you hold up a treat (^-^)b
Ah, I didn't think of that. I'll give it a shot.
I didn't think of that either... Thank you for the idea. Heheh.
wdym? they don't swarm you even when you're ignoring them?
It seems we have a Meowfficer whisperer among us.
You have an odd yet enviable talent.

options.text: They're confusing to deal with.

reply.text: I suppose you're not sure how to befriend them either, then.

options.text: I hope these little guys will all grow up well.

reply.text: I... assume based on your reply that there have been "incidents" in the past.

420.text: Goodness, I'm sorry... I knew I shouldn't have set foot outside my room.

comments.text: Don't apologize! It's my fault for not looking where I'm going.
You actually knocked Kashino over... How did you get so strong?!
I'm really sorry. This wouldn't have happened if I'd just stayed inside.
Are you ladies alright?
I'm fine. Just feeling sorry over bumping into Murasaki.
I'M the one who's sorry! *sniffle*... I'm never leaving my room again...
I think we've all apologised enough. Nobody got hurt, which is what matters.

options.text: How'd it happen? Were knockers involved in this knocking-over?

reply.text: Uhh, we quite literally bumped into each other...

options.text: I'll work on making that corridor wider.

reply.text: Please, there's no need to! I'll just never leave my room and it won't happen again.

comments.text: Wow! Where'd you learn that? I wanna try it too!
Fine, let's see who's got the chops to chop best! Meet me in the kitchen!
the kitchen is NOT for competing in!
Your six blades are impressive, but quantity does not trump quality. My sword is better.
Here comes Miss Class Rep... I bet Asuka egged you on.
Hey! Stop trying to pin every little thing on me!
Whoa! That's sick! You're like Wolverine!
You expect a shinobi to know him? Lol
No idea who that is, but I'll take it as a compliment.

options.text: With skills like that, you could cook for six people at once.

reply.text: Call me Chef Homura because I'm about to serve some people!

422.text: I was asked to share photographs of my everyday life, so here.

comments.text: Heh! Came out looking pretty good, didn't it?
It certainly did. Thank you for helping.
God that looks so tasty! I want a bite!
The meal was provided by yours truly, nya!
You're too kind, Akashi. I would've paid for it myself.
Don't thank me, nya! Thank the Commander who's footing the bill, nya!

options.text: Glad to see you like it.

reply.text: It was very generous of you to pay for my meal. You're a nice person.

423.text: I hope you're able to draw some cool from this dance.

comments.text: Your dance was wonderful in all regards, from your taste in folding fans to the elegance of your moves.
Thank you for your kind words. You have quite a lovely fan of your own.
You ninjas have moves, seriously! That gave me some good inspo! Need to write it down before I forget!
Inspo...? Well, I'm glad my dance served you well.
If I had your power, I'd use it to drink cold vodka whenever I want.
Now you're speaking my language! Just no drinking on the job, okay?
I'll gladly use it for that purpose whenever you'd like.

options.text: This would save a ton on AC bills during the summer.

reply.text: Why, yes, it would. All you need do is ask, and I'll perform my cooling arts.

424.text: I can't seem to find any hidden mechanisms or rooms inside the office.

comments.text: Oh, my Doggo Cattron 3000! It's still on the shelf!
Your what? Do you mean this thing that looks like a black cat?
Da Vinci! Don't tell me you left that in the Commander's office while nobody was looking!
You don't think that weird toy is the key to opening a secret room?
I did examine it but it really is just a regular, albeit weird toy. For being such a vital part of the port, the office is severely lacking in security.

options.text: What did you expect? It's an ordinary office.

reply.text: It shouldn't be. You need to have a hidden panic room if there's ever an emergency.

options.text: Even if we DID upgrade the security, well...

reply.text: Well, what? Please elaborate, Commander.

425.text: Peeps who didn't believe that I was multitalented, check this out!

comments.text: Why are you on a unicycle?
Why not?
Aight, I've got nothing.
Hey that looks sick actually! You need to teach me how to do that!
Me too! Teach me, Coach! This would make one hell of a surprise act!
Then teach you I will! I'll make pros out of you in no time!

options.text: Talk about juggling multiple things at once.

reply.text: In more ways than one!

options.text: Just be careful so you don't lose balance and tip over.

reply.text: Pfft! Who do you take me for? I know what I'm doing!

426.text: Here's your order, Commander... Ugh, so eepy...

comments.text: Look out Laffey you're gonna spill your drinks!!! Î£(ï½¥Ï‰ï½¥ï¾‰)ï¾‰
Nuh-uh. I've practiced catering so much I can do it in my sleep.
Don't be silly! You WILL spill if you attempt that!
Have you tried coffee if you're having trouble staying up?
But I prefer oxy-cola...
It's always oxy-cola with you... Whatever works, I suppose.
Get some sugar in your system if you need to stay awake. A few bottles of oxy-cola should do the trick.
Does sugar really do that?
Got it. I'll go chug the store's entire supply...

options.text: Sleepy? Then you should lie down.

reply.text: Is that your official permission to nap I hear? Don't mind if I do...

options.text: I think my drink got to the table half-empty...

reply.text: I must've spilled a few drops... I'll get you a new one.

427.text: Let's see what your horoscope is today...

comments.text: Did you stay up all night again yesterday? You can't keep doing this!
What have I told you, Constellation? Your immune system will suffer if you don't get enough sleep. Don't make me scold you on this.
But... I sleep during the day...
I saw today's gonna be a great day for stargazing. You wanna come along?
Yeah, it's gonna be totally cloudless. You don't wanna miss it.
Sounds stellar. Let's discuss the time and place later.
Can you predict specific things, or is it limited to one's general luck?
Of course. What do you want to know? How your business will do? How your relationships will go?
I'm most curious about my romance prospects...
You should probably take this convo to her DMs, sis...

options.text: I'll bite. What's mine?

reply.text: You'll find yourself firmly ensnared by a romantic tangle soon. Not really; your luck today is going to be fantastic.

options.text: I still can't believe how huge your channel is.

reply.text: It makes me happy to know so many people enjoy watching my horoscope readings. How do you like them, Commander?

428.text: Omggg these are sooo cute! I literally can't T.T

comments.text: You okay? Why are you crying?
It's the plushies they're so cute I'm cryingggg
Okay...?
dsfjfsjnns can you make one for me? preddy pls??? a fish one would be so cute
Sure I can do that. Which fish tho?
idk lol a shark? yeah let's go with shark

options.text: Why don't we take them with us on an aquarium trip?

reply.text: Yes sounds great!! I just saw your message and I'm already excited!!

options.text: Did you make those yourself? If so, wow, you're so talented!

reply.text: Hehehe they're easy to make really... there's one I wanna give you actually. I'll bring it with me next time!!

429.text: Phew, that's everything done at last. Now we can rest.

comments.text: Did you do all that work ahead of time?
Yup. I didn't want the Commander to have to work like a dog, so yeah.
Good thinking. However, you should strive to improve overall workplace efficiency instead of crunching due to tight deadlines.
Taking it slow is fine and all, some of us just feel spurred on by a deadline, no matter how long it is.
ain't that the truth...
Leaving the Commander to sit around idly, with no work to do... Yes, that's a great idea.
Hey, I'm just helping out here.

options.text: You did ALL that by yourself?

reply.text: Sure did! Enjoy your free time, Commander.

options.text: Thanks a bunch. What do you say we get dinner together later?

reply.text: Are you asking me on a date now? Heh, I'll think about it.

430.text: Dice the onions, cut the carrots and potatoes, throw them in a pot and boil...

comments.text: At least if nothing else, you know your cooking.
Really? You think so?
Of course. You even know your recipes wholly by heart.
Good start! Where's the juicy meat tho?
Now, now, vegetables are healthier for you.
you cant make good cookin without good veggies! shameless self-promo but you wanna see what I got?
You should come to my store instead, nya! I guarantee 100% customer satisfaction whether it's meat or vegetables you're buying, nya!
Thanks for the idea. I'd love to check out both your stores, but I don't remember the way to them...

options.text: Sounds delicious already!

reply.text: Why, thank you. I'll set some aside just for you, Commander.

options.text: You have the memory of an elephant when it comes to cooking.

reply.text: I would say it's more muscle memory than brain memory. By the way, I'll bring you a portion later, Commander.

431.text: Oohh man, this outfit is pretty tight... I should change into a bigger size.

comments.text: The Type II upgrade made you grow. More so in some places than others...
Did it? I guess it did...
So if retrofitting doesn't get you the result you want, maybe a Type II does...
I know what you're talking about, Saratoga, and you're fine just the way you are!
Yeah, I agree.

options.text: Please don't. This is fine.

reply.text: Is it? Well, if you insist...

options.text: I think this size looks amazing on you.

reply.text: Really? I'll take your word for it then.

comments.text: Congrats on your purchase, nya! I'll let you know when I have new wares in stock, nya.
Product's utility value: excellent. Thank you.
I can't believe I didn't come up with this invention first... Time to hit the drawing board!
Invention is an accurate descriptor as it was made to satisfy a specific fantasy.
Please leave a review if you like it, nya.
Cool! Btw, is it possible to change the background?
Yes. It incorporates all the latest technology and you may change the background as you please.
Sweet. I'm gonna get one for myself and live out my superhero fantasies!

options.text: User preference mode? What's that?

reply.text: A mode featuring an appearance and behavior tailored to your particular preferences, Commander.

options.text: You're looking fine today.

reply.text: Thank you. This outfit was specially designed based on data of your preferences and fancies.

433.text: This card all but guarantees your loss.

comments.text: I see! So you're the Goddess of Gambling in the mortal world!
Call me whatever you want. What matters is that I will win.
Always trust in the heart of the cards!
That's a very different card game you're thinking of...
So what? There is nothing stopping us from using a different ruleset as well.

options.text: Milady, have mercy on me!

reply.text: You're already pleading for mercy, hmm?

options.text: It's not over until it's over!

reply.text: While I do like your confidence, confidence is no substitute for good cards. Do you really think you can beat me?

434.text: Okay, the tea should be just the right temperature now. Here you go.

comments.text: What are you up to? Practicing making tea?
Not quite. I'm practicing my dragon's breath. I'll boil the tea if I'm not careful, you see.
You can breathe fire?! No wonder you're called the Dragon God!
I've got coasters with cooling and heating functions if you're interested, nya. Try it out, nya!
Knowing Akashi, she'll no doubt charge an arm and a leg for one of those.
What? Really?

options.text: That must've taken a lot of practice.

reply.text: Yes, though it was worth it. I'm in control of my breath now.

options.text: Mmm. Smells fragrant.

reply.text: Of course it does! 'Tis the Dragon God's tea!

435.text: Just going to put a liiittle bit of *********** in here.

comments.text: Are you sure that's drinkable?
Certain, even. I'm only letting the Commander drink it, though.
I'm kinda worried for the Commander's well-being now (._.)
I'm curious what effect that potion has.
It's a secret! You'll see.
May I ask you to please teach me the recipe for this new beverage?
How bold of you... I cannot share the recipe, but I can give you a bottle of it.
Thank you kindly!

options.text: A little bit of... what?

reply.text: I won't spoil it. You'll know once you taste it.

options.text: Did you censor that word yourself, or...?

reply.text: Don't fret over the unimportant details. All you need to know is I added something good to your drink.

436.text: I must complete this sacred duty posthaste.

comments.text: Boy that looks like hard work... I'm feeling secondhand exhaustion just from looking at it
No effort shall be spared in the Commander's name!
